Reviews.Title: “Rooms are good, not great - but IPO restaurant is a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler1966
Reviews.Content: The rooms are ok, but far from exciting or luxurious, and the housekeeping was quite disappointing (never replace water, left cleaning supplies in the room, didn't replace all the towels) but like my last stay - I'm a huge fan of IPO. The mussels app and the hangar steak are exceptional. The staff is friendly and helpful, but not energetic about going the extra mile for SPG Platinum guest. I hate "asking" for benefits that should be offered.

Reviews.Title: “W Wedding”
Reviews.Author: ndg2000
Reviews.Content: the W was wonderful. the wedding we went to was well done, food very good, room beautiful! The manager lent me his cufflinks, which was a lifesaver, as I had everything for my Tux, except them. All in all, a great experience. Only one little disappointment, fancy hotels shouldn't be charging for WiFi--that is no longer a luxury, but an expectation, a given in today's world.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable room and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew S
Reviews.Content: The room was simply nice, functional, and spacious. It was one of the nicest rooms I've stayed in for a hotel in this price range (i.e., excepting Ritz-Carlton- and Four Seasons-type hotels). The staff, however, is what made this stay wonderful. They blew me away! When I checked in, I got a free room upgrade. Next, the concierge (Tk) was quite helpful and put in a lot of effort. She made some amazing recommendations for a first-time Chicagoan and called ahead to various places for reservations. Even at the end, when I had to check out at an abysmally late time, the staff was helpful and offered to waive the fee. The best part is that this wasn't special treatment. I don't (currently) have frequent stay status with the W / SPG, and I saw them demonstrate the same level of hospitality to other guests. They really go out of their way -- even the check in counter had the most delicious cookies and hot chocolate, free for guests all day long. I'd strongly recommend a stay at the W, and plan to return if my travels bring me back to Chicago for a hotel in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “W is for wonderful”
Reviews.Author: FDGNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W City Center while on business trip. Service was great especially the concierge TK who made a great recommendation for a dinner where I'd be comfortable dining alone and even offered to have the hotels Accura car drive me there. Hotel is clean comfortable and chic. The rooms are spacious and modern. Staff is friendly and courteous and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Only choice in Chicago if you're planning something special”
Reviews.Author: HotelDeeDee
Reviews.Content: What sets this hotel apart is the concierge service. (TK and Eden are exceptional!) TK did EVERYTHING in planning an elegant birthday weekend surprise for my boyfriend and she was meticulous in making sure every detail was perfect. It included a scavenger hunt at the hotel, reservations at incredible restaurants, limo service and she made us feel incredibly special. The only thing that maybe could of been a bit better was the room but I think the service at this property is truly what sets it apart. It is small and intimate enough for everyone to be in on a birthday surprise and really contribute to making it perfect. So if you have any sort of occasion coming up call TK and Eden and let them take the reigns in creating something truly magical for you. They helped me create a truly beautiful memory.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service! One of my favorite W hotels!”
Reviews.Author: msc8210
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many W hotels around the world, and W Hotel City Center is indeed one of my favorite W hotels. The hotel is situated at a very convenient location in the center of Chicago. My stay is just simple perfect. The room is very spacious, clean, and quiet. I am extremely impressed with the attention to detail the hotel had put with everything. From the "good morning" and "good evening" elevator carpet, to the cupcakes, warm chocolate cookies, and hot cocoa served at the lobby. The service is way beyond my expectations!! Eden at the concierge was extremely friendly and helpful in providing us directions to our destinations and gave us many helpful restaurant recommendations and travel tips. The Acura experience was just simply comfortable and neat! The chauffeur was very professional and allowed us to experience the vehicle fully. The lobby is clean and well-decorated. We also ordered room service and had a drink at the lobby bar. Overall, the amazing staff and excellent service at the hotel made my first trip to Chicago memorable and I will definitely go back and stay there again. :D

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Best!”
Reviews.Author: 598SLR598
Reviews.Content: I was completely impressed with the W and give it my highest recommendation. Miguel and Eden sure know how to take care of you. They made my entire group feel extra special and without a doubt the W will be the first place I stay at the next time in the city. Take advantage of the free Acura experience when needing a ride to a destination. The W made my trip complete! Thank you to everyone there!

Reviews.Title: “Style but a little short on substance”
Reviews.Author: ad1206
Reviews.Content: Was in Chicago for a night and booked at the W City Center. I stayed at the Westin River North on my last visit and I have to say that my next trip will probably be back over there. While the W was in a great location (walking distance from where I needed to be) and the staff seemed very friendly I have to admit that I wasn't too impressed with the hotel. The insides of the building could use some renovation, the rooms were a bit small (compared to the Westin) and the workout facility was subpar at best. In addition, the toilet and the ipod dock were both broken in my room. Would have made a bigger deal about it but I was only there for a night. Having stayed at a number of W's in the US I'd have to say that there are many others out there that I think are better. If you have the choice I think you're much better off across the street at the JW or down the road at the Hyatt or Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Different and Classy Hotel Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Travellogue_80
Reviews.Content: I had visited Chicago in late January 2012 and stayed for 3 days at the W Chicago City Center. I must say, it is one of its kind when it comes to the way the hotel is planned. Most of the hotels, will have a big lobby area and a reception right after the gate but this one gives a different feeling as you enter. Some good music and a lounge right at the entrance, the lobby in itself starts after the lounge and has been designed like a lounge sitting. Great for the younger crowd, especially. The rooms are well equipped and very spacious with all amenities for comfort. The hotel staff, restaurants and room service - all are efficient and courteous. Excellent place, must say, Located right in the city center - close to business hub of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: sdr82
Reviews.Content: we had an amazing suite. The views are ok.. its smack in the middle of a bunch of buildings so as great as you can hope for. I stay at W's a lot and this was a really nice one. The interior is beautiful but the elevators are HORRIBLE! i mean the interior is horrible. They are decorated with bubbles or something and the idea is nice but when you are hung over the movement is the worst ever. I would think alot of people have issues with that. The concierge was really helpful as I was planning this trip in advance from another state. Great location

Reviews.Title: “Amazing personalized service”
Reviews.Author: Erica J
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at W hotels during my vacations, so I selected this one in Chicago. I was expecting the normal wherever, whenever service and trendy decorated chic rooms, lobbies and bars. What I didn't expect was personalized service. Before my arrival, I was greeted by Laurelin via email inquiring if I needed anything during my stay. I let her know it was my birthday. She responded immediately that she would like to offer some complimentary gifts on behalf of the W since I am a platinum member and also asked if I needed help with reservations at restaurants for my birthday night. Laurelin went above and beyond the "wherever whenever" slogan during my entire stay. Even though we already had reservations, she called hostesses to reconfirm our reservations for both the restaurant and nightclub to ensure a hassle-free evening. Additionally, she came to personally greet me after check-in. Because of her efforts, me and my girlfriends had an amazing time. It was not just Laurelin that provided outstanding service. We were asking where we could find a 7-11 and the doorman offered to go for us since it was freezing outside! Another time, we were in a hurry to get food so they helped us get into the Acura car and called ahead to the restaurant to let them know we were coming and needed to be served quickly! At the W you are not paying for a nice hotel, you are paying for the outstanding service. Laurelin really provided this and ensured that we had a memorable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “One night business stay midweek”
Reviews.Author: aryno
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my quick one night business trip here. It's nice to sit in the lobby and catch up on some work as the vibe is great- nice departure from some of the less interesting hotels and locations I usually travel to. While there I met Laurelin the W Insider. She had a ton of ideas for dinner and for my next visits to chicago as well as the other W hotels I had reservations at. Very relaxing evening and it was a pleasure to meet Laurelin, I like the concierge sevice that doesn't hide behind a desk. The doormen are fantastic, some of the best. Can't tell you how many times I check in and I am dragging my bags through double doors and no one stops to help me. These guys are on their game! Sometimes it's the little things. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Worst W Hotel ever... Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: SnoopDoubleD
Reviews.Content: This is the most disappointing W Hotel that I have ever stayed in (and I have stayed in many Wâ€™s). The lobby looks cool but the building is extremely old and the walls are very thin; so thin that I heard the guy next door on his cell for most of the night. The service was really disappointing, too. I checked-in with my current Platinum card in hand; however the front desk staff didnâ€™t bother to honor it. They didn't even give me a Platinum sleeve for my room key. The bathtub was clogged and the bathroom had no towels. When I called to request some towels, they asked me if the room was cleaned (which was a bit scary as I just checked-in). The only cool element of the room was the bed; everything else sucks. I finally broke down and called the hotel manager; he didn't bother to call me back. I'm beginning to wonder if it's worth maintaining my status with Starwood when their staff treats you so badly. This hotel does not live up to the W Brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the W Chicago City Center”
Reviews.Author: mjz_kc
Reviews.Content: The W Chicago City Center was a great choice for our most recent visit to Chicago. We were upgraded to a Spectacular room, which was spacious and very clean. Service at the hotel was spot on, and everyone I encountered was quite friendly. Free coffee, hot chocolate, afternoon treats, and WiFi in the lobby was a nice touch. I booked a special rate via Travelzoo, making this stay a fantastic value. The location was fine, with easy access to the El, cabs, or Acura Experience.

Reviews.Title: “W for Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: carmen h
Reviews.Content: Just stayed with friends at the W city Center and had an amazing experience. Wonderful interiors, great staff, brilliant concierge called Eden, great location. Would highly recommend to anyone for business or pleasure. Carmen and Amy

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre room”
Reviews.Author: april1955
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W last night. The hotel is dark from the time you walk through the entrance until you arrive at your room. When I got to my room, I started to unpack my suitcase and I noticed gum wrappers behind the clock. Then, I went to hang up my clothes and saw that a prior guest left his ties in the closet. I called the front desk and my room was promptly cleaned. But after flying in at night, the last thing I wanted was to have a room that had not been serviced by house keeping. I doubt I will stay at the W again.

Reviews.Title: “W Chicago - City Center - W Insider - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: MannyRios
Reviews.Content: Recently I visited Chicago with my fiance for the first time. We had the privileged of staying at a Starwood Hotel - the W Chicago - City Center. I was particularly impressed with the staff - especially Laurelin Hefter. The W Hotel is a highly recommended places to stay. The Hotel is incredibly well appointed and decorated. The modern appointments and helpful staff will make your stay pleasant and memorable. Due experience the Acura - well, experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Service!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen R
Reviews.Content: Excellent all around service, from the time we arrived, to transportation, restaurants and simply making us feel special. Wonderful service and exceptional concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Property - Unprecedented Service”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca P
Reviews.Content: I've always loved W properties - they're always unique, funky and fabulous and W City Center was no exception. What a great place to stay for a romantic weekend get away! Laurelin reached out to me before our trip - just the great kind of service that's unexpected but gives the stay an added great touch. The location was perfect for our needs - walking distance to Milennium Park, State Street Shopping, Miracle Mile. And, it wasn't their fault it was FREEZING out. Service from pulling up with the car through our departure was excellent. The room was clean, nice and the linens were superb. Great stay! Oh, this was a personal trip, but definitely would stay for business in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy repeat customer”
Reviews.Author: Stu T
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here only twice for work but Laurelin, one of the concierges, has made me feel like I've stayed here 100 times. The staff warmly greeted me, immediately looked for the best possible room, and even provided me with some complimentary beverages. Prior to my arrival, Laurelin even reached out to me via email to see if I needed any restaurant recommendations. Great service like this is so hard to find but I'm glad I found it at the W in the loop when I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Typical W... In a Bad Way”
Reviews.Author: Erica319
Reviews.Content: This is like a traditional W hotel's attractive, quieter, hard-to-get-to-know sister. The W City Center is still a bit of an enigma to me and I have stayed there several times. The first time I booked this hotel, I was surprised by its location, but drawn in by the name, I made the reservation and hoped for the best. Honestly, it is not as bad as some of the SPG hotels that I have stayed in, but it doesn't have the redeeming qualities of the other Ws. The thing about a typical W hotel is that beyond all of the pretentiousness is excellent service and cleanliness. This W has the cleanliness, but none of the excellent service. Most of the service I got boarded on you-are-interrupting-me-checking-into-foursquare-under-the-table looks and uninformed service on the phones. They usually have better pricing than the other Ws, but you won't get the benefits that come with the extra dollars. By "extras", I mean basic customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Night at the W.”
Reviews.Author: RunMorganRun
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a birthday celebration night for my wife at the hotel and had a fantastic stay. Laurelin went over and above the normal level of service you would expect. Or room was perfect with a nice view, comfortable bed, quiet heat and A/C and no disturbances. We were within walking distance of the Art Museum and our chosen dinner spot (the Berghoff), so the day and night were very low stress and enjoyable. Laurelin had a nice card and a few other surprises ready for my wife when we arrived, which made it all the more special. Thanks to the W and especially Laurelin.

Reviews.Title: “Eat the food!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda L
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the W City Center 3 nights a week for some time now, on business. The staff is pleasant and ever so helpful -- to be expected from the hotel. But what gets the place an "excellent" rating from me is the over-arching helpfulness that comes from the front of house at the hotel restaurant, IPO. My coworker and I work late nights, and mostly just come back to the hotel to get out of the office and continue working. Because of this, there is barely any time to go out and explore the food there is in Chicago, so IPO tends to be the place to go. This doesn't bother us because the food is quite superb -- we're still working our way through the menu! The staff in the front of house know us by now and it's nice to be greeted with familiar faces. Jamie, in particular, has been the most warm, pleasant person I've ever dealt with while on business. She really makes it feel like a home away from home, and takes care of me and my coworker through the long nights of work! My coworker and I contemplated trying out the Westin just north of the river, for the change of scene and perhaps an ability to try a new restaurant or two, but Jamie's attention and service to us is honestly the reason why we're not leaving. Thank you, Jamie, for your kindness!

Reviews.Title: “W City Center Perfect for Business Trips + Fun”
Reviews.Author: Jess G
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at W City Center many times. Great bar scene to relax with a cocktail after a long day. Chic, good looking crowd and yummy drinks. Had an in room massage with Bartek and loved it. Be sure to ask for courtyard facing room to avoid noise from train. Rooms are cozy and good eats on room service menu which is a must for me. Hotel service is always very good. Bend over backwards to accommodate. This is a must for business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Club W (untz untz untz)”
Reviews.Author: leconteurX
Reviews.Content: W City Center became home away from home for my many trips to Chicago through 2011. I stayed here 1 to 2 weeks at a time several times for both business and while house-hunting when I decided I loved the city enough to pick up and move from Maryland. The rooms are as expected from W Hotels. They're trendy, stylish and comfortable and The Living Room provided for a great central meeting location. I gave this hotel a "Very Good" rating because I love SPG and Starwood properties, particularly Westins and W's. I don't love it but you'll be hard pressed to find such accommodations at a comparable rate anywhere else in the city. It's kind of a night club. All day and night the Living Room is dimly lit with bass thumping which cranks up at night. Personal account: After one evening of excessive drinking, the heavy bass reverberating through my chest was enough to make me a shade greener than I already was. Concierge is a little less than warm but very helpful nonetheless. They gave me some great neighborhood pointers as I was searching for my new home.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: letsgofire
Reviews.Content: The W City Center has always been an interesting option for visitors to Chicago. It is in the heart of the business district, but caters to customers who would rather be going to a nightclub. At most W hotels, service from the staff is usually spotty at best. Frequent travelers know what I mean. However I was happy to report that the staff was quite helpful and friendly and in-line with the star rating of the hotel. Room was okay. The rooms are very style-conscious, and I felt that some aspects worked and others didn't. All 3 lounge areas of the hotel drew a good crowd. This is definitely a hotel to have some fun at. This is a good pick for a short weekend in Chicago, but probably not the best option for a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience in the world and reception staff is a bxxxh”
Reviews.Author: martin l
Reviews.Content: when I was trying to ask the receptionist questions, she stopped me several times and there was even no eye contact or any explanations when she did that. when I just wanted to double check with her which of my credit card would be charged for second night (I booked two rooms for two nights for me and my business friends, and I used two credit cards to pay), she stopped me again and spoke to me rudely, so I couldnâ€™t put up with her, then I requested to speak to her supervisor or any other staff. What happened next is she yelled at me saying, â€œI am not going to deal with youâ€�, and then she slapped the keyboard, turned back and walked in the room behind her. I even wrote an email to the hotel's customer service staff afterwards. There is NO APOLOGY, NO EXPLANATION, NO FOLLOW-UP whatsoever, and it looks like there is nothing to the W hotel. IF YOU WANT TO GET HUMILIATED IN PUBLIC, PLEASE COME TO STAY AT THIS W HOTEL!!!!!!! More info about this hotel: no coffee or any complimentary drink/snack provided, and its rooms are very small, maybe even smaller than master suite bathroom in your house. There is no view at all: my room was at 12 floor and only 4-5 feet away from a office building (I could see clearly people doing in that building, and vice versus). The lobby is crowded and loud.

Reviews.Title: “3 day Chicago staycation”
Reviews.Author: nick p
Reviews.Content: PROS: The overall service was a 10 out of 10. Starting with Laurelin, the concierge! She was on top of every e-mail and phone call I placed prior to my arrival and made sure our weekend started off on a good foot. The lobby was pretty cool, the bed was amazing, and the lighting in the room was great. We utilized the free Acura service which I recommend to anyone staying here. CONS: No dressers to unpack clothes, only a small closet to hang garments. Iron was broken, had to call to have another brought up... not a big deal at all really. View from our room was kind of stunk, we looked onto a bunch of air conditioning units. OVERALL: I would return for the service and the sleeping conditions. I fortunately got a pretty good deal on the room. After staying there I would have been upset if I paid full price.

Reviews.Title: “Waisting time.”
Reviews.Author: Allen L
Reviews.Content: I called the front desk about a week ago trying to get more information about your slow season rates because my computer was down, it was late night and no one answered the phone .I thought maybe I had the wrong number so I called again and still no answer. The phones should be answered in a timely fashion .

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend stay at W City Center”
Reviews.Author: Will H
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful weekend at the W City Center. The hotel itself is very nice with just the right amount of traffic and buzz for a weekend in the city, it's not super busy but not super dead. However, keep in mind you're in the financial district so it's a short car or cab ride away to some of the more happening parts of town. I came from a tradeshow at the Navy Pier and we visited both the Shedd Aquarium and Art Institute over the weekend, so it was a convenient locale for us. The Acura car service is a nice touch, we used it three times during our stay and was much nicer than a cab ride. They have limited hours, but it was awesome when it worked with our schedule. I was literally snowed-in on Friday when the city received 3-5" of snow and Laurelin Hefter, the W Insider, was super nice and made sure I had everything I needed for the night since traffic around the city was at a standstill and cabs were nowhere to be seen. She turned a miserable night into a comfortable evening at the hotel. Gym was nice, IPO has a decent menu and the bar has everything you expect of a hotel bar. We were lucky to have an upgraded (SPG Gold) interior corner room that was farther away from the train, so you only heard a muffled train and very little traffic. The bed was amazingly comfortable, didn't want to get up other than go downstairs for a free cup of coffee in the morning. Honestly, only the location and traffic/train noise keep this hotel from receiving 5 stars for leisure travelers. FYI, overnight valet parking is $55, but there are plenty of self-park lots in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Modern chic hotel in a great downtown chicago location!”
Reviews.Author: Britt B
Reviews.Content: My friend came into town and we decided to go to Chicago for the weekend. She was able to get us a discount from work, so it's hard to comment on the value. The street in front of the hotel was under construction so it was hard to pull up to the front and drop off bags (we weren't parking at the hotel) without feeling rushed, but the bell-hops were more than friendly and accommodating. Hotel was beautiful - dark, modern, and very 'cool'. The room however was TINY - literally smaller than my college dorm! You couldn't get around the perimeter of the bed without needing to first move something. The room was very clean though and we didn't have problems with traffic noise, but that's because we had an less-than-ideal view facing inwards to other rooms / offices / etc. I've stayed in other Chicago hotels though and the size of this hotel wasn't completely unusual, it just always shocks me. The bathroom was also tiny, and you couldn't turn on the water in the shower without getting your arm wet - poor design. Breakfast the next morning was very good, and wait staff was very friendly. They slightly messed up my friends breakfast, but we very apologetic and happy to fix. This hotel is in a GREAT location to all major chicago attractions, and a bit of a walk to michigan ave, but it can be done! Overall, very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, clubby”
Reviews.Author: Bgswm1
Reviews.Content: If that is what you are going for, then it is ok, but otherwise I highly recommend looking elsewhere. The service is good and the beds are comfortable (like all W's) but the ambiance just isn't that cool anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holidays at W hotel”
Reviews.Author: ychae
Reviews.Content: I visited Chicago to spend some time with my boyfriend on Christmas day which was also our anniversary. We stayed at W hotel in Chicago city center for two nights, and it was more than satisfactory! Not only I liked the neat, clean, modern decor and warm atmosphere of "spectacular" king bedroom, but also the service was great. I emailed my W Insider (Ms. Laurelin Heather), ahead of time to let her know that I'd like to celebrate our anniversary in the room, and she arranged a complimentary room service with a bottle of Prosecco, decorated cookies, brownies, and ice cream just for two of us! Also, she let me send her my gift (for boyfriend) before we arrived there, so she could send it to our room along with the room service. As the room service arrived exactly at 12am on the Christmas day, and we enjoyed the celebration very much, and it was so romantic! We also got complimentary VIP tickets to the Skydeck lounge, which is just few blocks away from the hotel. We looked up the normal time for sunset in Chicago and arrived there on time. The sunset and the city view from Skydeck was so beautiful! In addition, all the staffs were very kind and willing to help. We enjoyed the holiday (and anniversary!) so much, and I doubt that there could be any better place to stay in Chicago. We are looking forward to visiting the W hotel again! Thanks to my W Insider and all the other staffs for making us wonderful memories :)

Reviews.Title: “w is GREAT”
Reviews.Author: cambroclt
Reviews.Content: stayed at the W for a wedding offsite and truly enjoyed my time! Lobby bar was great, they should not let people entere through the bar door to the street, but rather keep guests going in and out through the hotel main entrance. Room was very small but cute, figured out that most rooms are different in size to one another after seeing the HUGE room our friends received at the same rate (dont get a corner room if you want space) bathroom was similar in size to a airplane bathroom. At least it was super modern and clean! Staff at the bar/concierge/front desk were more than helpful, made us "hard to get" reservations at a local gastropub with ease and gave us the VIP treatment all around. W hotels have signature scents in the lobby, each time i smell the same smell that the W chicago had, it brought me back to fond memories... Unfortunately, the grocery store brand scented trashbags have the same smell... still good thoughts :) WILL RETURN

Reviews.Title: “a goofy room, but love the vibe of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: purplehatartist
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before, but it's been about 3 years. I've always enjoyed the modern, hip vibe of this hotel, even though I'm a senior citizen. They have done some remodeling and updating since our last visit, and it was fun to check out the new decor. Our room was a "spectacular" room, and it was nice, but it certainly had some curiosities. I suppose it was built for a family with children, but it was just my husband and myself. The room, upon entering, has a closet and hallways to both the left and right. On the right was a bathroom with a sliding door, and the comfy King bed with a 52" plasma on the wall. I love that there was a docking station for my iPod. As we played around with the lighting, we noticed the bed is lit underneath--kinda cool. There's a sliding door on the wall that as you open, lights up to reveal a bottle of wine, 2 nice wineglasses, and a corkscrew. We had brought our own wine, but it was a nice surprise to have the glasses already there, without having to call for some. Down the left hallway was another bathroom, without a shower, and an additional sitting room with sofa and chair and another 52" plasma! I imagine the sofa folded out into a bed, but we just enjoyed having an alternate place to view the Bulls game. The decor was interesting and fun. And I love the luxurious bed and linens. On the negative side, the toilets in both bathrooms were really cramped in there--not much leg room in the one, and the other one, you had to reach back behind the vanity to flush. The tub in the shower had several chips and the drain looked a bit yucky. We were staying only one night, so it was not a problem for us, but definitely a turn-off. And of course, the ever-present el that you don't seem to notice at all until you're sleeping. It didn't keep us awake, but it is likely a problem for many. We had breakfast at IPO, and it was standard. As we left for dinner, I noticed the lounge area was definitely a happening place, with many people and the iconic jazzy music. When we returned a couple hours later, it was mostly empty. In all, we enjoyed our stay, but next time we will ask for a room above the 10th floor, to be farther away from the el.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the cookies”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan M
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago for work frequently, and I needed to return on short notice. My typical hotel was booked, so my assistant booked me at the W on West Adams. I was pleasantly surprised by not only the convenient location but attentive staff. Upon checking in, I stopped at the concierge to get restaurant ideas for any new places that recently opened. I was feeling sushi, and Lauralin, the W insider, gave me a perfect recommendation for the type of restaurant I was looking for. I finished off dinner with a W cookie - which are a can't miss - that are in the lobby. My hotel room was a little smaller than the room size I typically have, but the convenience, quality and attention to service at the W make-up for that slight shortfall â€“ I havenâ€™t been back so maybe it was just that room. Overall, the W made a great first, lasting impression. I plan to make it me new go-to hotel the next time my travels take me to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The best Starwood Property in Chicago?”
Reviews.Author: stylo4444
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit every year, mostly for business but decided to take a trip to Chicago and meet some friends out there for New Years. I've been to Chicago before and stayed at the W Lakeshore and was originally planning on staying there, but they did not have availability for New Years Eve so I decided to give the W City Center a try as I always seem to have a good stay at W's. First off, this hotel is very conveniently located within The Loop. If you're coming from MDW, it's right off Quincy and about 100 feet down the road. There are a couple convenience stores nearby, coffeeshops, and countless restaurants all within walking distance. From the outside, you can tell this is not the newest structure in the world but it has been renovated and just looks classy. You walk in, and step into what must be the most unique looking Living Room (lobby) of all W hotels. It's classy, elegant, and you can't help but like how historic it looks! I had a bit of a later than expected arrival the first night, but was greeted by the Welome Agent Amanda who actually recalled speaking to me over the phone a few nights earlier. This may not seem like a big deal, but these people must take a lot of phone calls every day and to be able to recall something like that was just a nice litte personal touch that I can appreciate. She informed me that I had been upgraded to a Fantastic Suite on the 5th floor and gave me a quick rundown of the hotel facilities and I was on my way up to my room. The Fantastic Suite itself is a very nice large suite, with a layout similar to that of a horseshoe. The room was in great condition, the bed looking very modern and similar to those found at other newer W's. This is the complete opposite of the W Lakeshore where the rooms are simply starting to look dated, and are much smaller. The bathroom was very clean, and I took a quick shower before wanting to head out for a little bit and get some items that I had forgotten back home. As I went back downstairs, Amanda had asked me how everything was and I asked her where the nearest convenience store was and how late they are open. She asked me if there was anything I needed, and I told her I was looking for contact lens solution and shaving cream. I have stayed at other Starwood properties and the shaving cream tends to be in little throw away packets while contact solution is in a very small bottle and that's if they have any. She went back and came with a travel size shaving cream canister and a large bottle of contact solution which was complimentary. This was very surprising, and very pleasant to see and probably the first time I have seen this in my years as an SPG member. I then asked her about quick dinner spots nearby since Concierge was not on-duty at the time (it was late) and she probably gave me a list of maybe a dozen or so restaurants within walking distance! The entire time, she was very pleasant to deal with and sometimes I feel like these are the little things that really make a stay go from 4 stars to 5 stars. I never left the hotel that night and dined at IPO which is their signature restaurant. I rarely ever do this as I find hotel restaurants to be overpriced and lacking in quality and overall service. IPO proved this to be wrong, as the food was reasonably priced and the Sturgeon I had was absolutely delicious! I went back up to my room and had a nice nights sleep shortly after. I returned back to this property two nights later for New Years Eve, and arrived earlier than expected as the W Lakeshore (sold out for NYE) disappointed on many levels. I was very glad to be back and walking through the lobby was greeted by Laurelin who I later found out was actually the W Insider at this hotel. Anthony Ortega, who is one of the management staff at this hotel checked me in and upgraded me to a Fabulous Room since all Suites were sold out. He also recalled speaking to me earlier in the week and made me feel very welcome. I went up to my room on the 14th floor and it was larger than expected. Very spacious, very modern, and in immaculate condition. I kept wondering why I even ever stayed at the W Lakeshore the night before, I should have stayed here for my entire trip! I went downstairs to get some dining recommendations for lunch. I had a bad experience with Concierge at the Lakeshore the day before, and this left me disappointed and wondering why ever go to a Concierge if they don't make the effort to help you and make you feel like other things are more important than your time? Laurelin Hefter, the W Insider at this property restored my trust by giving me recommendations for lunch, and I not only had lunch but also dinner at the places recommended. Insiders at W's know the hotel inside out, know whats around the city, and always give the best recommendations while ensuring that the service remains enjoyable. She also gave me directions and her card, and let me know to give her a call if I need anything else while I am out. I've spoken with many of the Insiders at various W hotels and always found them to be a pleasure to deal with, they really know their stuff and Laurelin was a standout and probably the best Insider I have dealt with yet. They're all great, but this was just on another level I felt. The Insiders can take care of anything for you really, and had I not had friends get us a table at Vision for NYE, I know that the Laurelin would have helped us greatly! Checking out the next day, I almost did not want to leave. But I left knowing that the next time I am in Chicago, I will be staying here without hesitation. Chicago is a big city so there are many Starwood properties here, but there are a few things that separate this hotel from the rest. It's a unique building, the rooms are great and better than other Starwoods in the area, it's in a convenient location and houses a better than average restaurant in IPO, but the thing that makes this the best Starwood in Chicago is the incredibly well-trained staff that really make you feel taken care. This is a talented team of individuals that will do what they can to ensure your stay is as enjoyable as possible. From the Management staff in Brian and Anthony, the Welcome agent in Amanda Sweetman, and the W Insider Laurelin...and the rest of the hotel staff, this is exactly why I remain loyal to the SPG program and why I cannot wait until the next I am back in the Windy City. Best Starwood in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “W City Center Chicago for Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Nicole R
Reviews.Content: The W at your hotel must stand for â€œWOWâ€�. My wife, Nicole and I just stayed at your property over the Christmas Holiday and weâ€™re still raving about the experience. From the moment we checked in, to the moment we said good-bye, our visit was the best weâ€™ve experienced in our travels. Your concierge team is second to none! Thank you Laurelin, T.K., Eden and Vanessa for taking such great care of us! The room service was fast, friendly and always accommodating. Keep up the fabulous quality service! C Forman

Reviews.Title: “W Chicago City Center for NYE”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of downtown Chicago, this W hotel offered a fantastic escape from the real world. The lobby was perfectly low-lit and set the mood for a wild NYE weekend. Check-in was relatively simple, although it took a while to get to a desk agent (to be expected for a busy night). The room was smaller than other W's I have stayed at but was still very comfortable. By far the best aspect of the trip was the excellent customer service I received from Laurelin Hefter at the concierge desk. From the get-go she was willing and able to provide insight and recommendations on everything from dinner to nightlife. In the end she was able to get our group 10 tickets to a great nightclub at a very sizable discount. Overall, her excellent commitment to quality customer service made the trip a great success.

Reviews.Title: “Like the sounds of the L train rattling your room?”
Reviews.Author: AHSteinberg
Reviews.Content: I checked in to the W Lakeshore for a business trip in December for two nights. I got a decent sized room initially but after 5 minutes when the L train passed by, my room rattled and it was extremely noisy. Keep in mind in live in NYC. I went to get my room changed and was moved to a higher floor but a smaller room and equally as noisy. I asked to be changes to one of the quieter rooms and was told they were oversold. They still charged me full price for my downgraded room and offered no other concessions. I'd recommend the James any day over this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but nothing particularly special.”
Reviews.Author: islandhunterraar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our engagement. The room was a decent size, but not very large compared to other major hotels in Chicago. Check in was super easy and quick, and I can't complain about the staff at all. We had to laugh at the incidental prices in the room. My favorite part of our stay was the Bliss Spa products... so much so that I'll probably stay at the other W location on Lakeshore to go to the spa!

Reviews.Title: “Such a pretty hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tasha M
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff and the hotel itself was really, really nice. Nothing but good things to say about my trip here and the city itself - I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The W City Center fabulous from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca A
Reviews.Content: My stay at The W City Center Chicago was fantastic from start to finish. The hotel was sheik and had a young and fresh feel to it. The lobby is gorgeous with high cathedral ceilings that gave a historic/vintage twist to the modern dÃ©cor. From the moment I arrived I was well greeted and all of the staff was kind in courteous. The hotel reception Alan was exceptionally helpful in all matters from providing a shoe service to fix my broken high heel to a making sure that I received my room service on time. Given that I am from Los Angeles and was in Chicago for my first time alone, the staff made me feels comfortable and at home. The W also went above and beyond by assisting with directions to nearby Chicago attractions and provided a complimentary car by The Acura Experience to check out the city for free! I was minutes away from everything and the rooms were spacious and clean and updated. The only down side was the bartenders that were at the lounge below could have been a little more friendly but other than that I had such a great time I want to return sooner than later to The W City Center! Thanks again to all the staff at The W for providing me with an excellent stay. In Short------ Pros: *Alan in reception, Service, The Acura Experience, nice rooms, comfy bed, Jean in accounting Cons: The bartenders in the lobby lounge could have been a little more friendly

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Calm”
Reviews.Author: wingedwoman
Reviews.Content: While trendy with a techno vibe this W is surprisingly calming. I was upgraded to a spacious, attractive room...offered a free lift within a 5 mile radius with their "Acura Experience" and treated with such warmth and friendliness by the staff I did not want to leave. Located in the Loop it's a nice walk to Millennium Park & museums and close to public transport. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christian C
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel, great location, the staff is very attentive and helpful, the decor and atmosphere is super chic and amazing all mederno the price can be a bit high but well worth the acura service seemed like a very good form of marketing

Reviews.Title: “Trend........y”
Reviews.Author: iscreenwriter
Reviews.Content: I live in Chicago so i know it inside and out. Had a business conference and found it easier to stay here for a night with my partners. Typical W property. Lounge - trendy trance music. Room is a little small but has everything you need.....and THE BED!!! W has the most comfortable bed you can imagine. Nice TV. Was happy.

Reviews.Title: “Always a fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelinM1ke
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stay at a lot of hotels, particularly Starwood. Whenever we come here, there is never a problem getting upgraded to the e wow suite (which is more of a homier layout than the on on lakeshore). The service is always great, the front desk is super friendly, and I have never had a problem with noise complaints (we have our friends come and hang out with us to pregame before going out). One of my favorite W hotels

Reviews.Title: “How can a hotel be THIS GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Tom F
Reviews.Content: I've taken a new job and my employer requires me to stay at the W Chicago City Center whenever I am in Chicago. Sweet! I've stayed there twice now and honestly, it is quickly becoming my favorite hotel. The place is alive with people. The decor is insanely great. They even offer complementary rides in an Acura SUV. But you know what my number one favorite thing about this place is? The staff. They are always so "on" (and I mean that in a good way). Always smiling, friendly... and it all seems so effortless for them... never forced, like you find in other hotels. They feel like family, even if it is my first time encounter with them. This even extends to the chap who brought my room service up. Now, I will warn you that one of my colleagues finds this type of hotel to be "too alive" for him. So be forewarned: this isn't for everyone. But, if you are into a place with great style, great people, and a lively atmosphere... you just gotta check this place out!

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive, not very inviting”
Reviews.Author: BarneyO
Reviews.Content: The W is a trendy style hotel, with a busy, noisy entry and public bars. The decor is ultra-modern, lighting dark, busy. Some of my travel companions like this style and refer to the hotel as "Funky" and "lively". I must qualify my review by saying I do not like this style of hotel and that influences some of the ratings. The biggest influence though is the price. The hotel was very expensive, even compared to other options in Chicago. I chose to pay extra out of my own pocket for the brand. I was very disappointed, both by the style of the hotel and the services recieved. The room is stark and has a lot of modern, gimicky furnishings, including a metre squared light with a business slogan worded across it. Just not my style. The main problem I had was with booking a wake up call. I rang at 2:00 am to book a 6:00 am wake up. The operator did not acknowledge who I was, the time or provide any friendly greetings. Then I was woken up at 5:00am insteady of 6:00 am. The operator offered minimal appologies, and when I repeated several times I still need the 6 oclock call, provided minimal acknowledgement. I set my phone alram in case, which woke me up a 6:00 am. When I checked out out 7:00 am I had not received the call still. One example perhaps, but I think relfects the service culture in a hotel that seems all about flash and dazzle and not so much on substance. Being an SPG member, I have tried to stay with this group in my travels. This is the third strike in a row for Sheraton, so I am afraid that approach is now changed. Last word, it is very noisy, with passing trains echoing through the central atrium. Suggest they provide earplugs for guests as the noise is not going away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tjm100
Reviews.Content: Always a joy, fast check - in and out, helpful staff and never a hassle. Great location for all the offices (CBOT, Sears Tower)

Reviews.Title: “If you got a problem, yo the W gonna solve it! :)”
Reviews.Author: Kaia Laurel R
Reviews.Content: Right so my overnight stay at the W Hotel City Centre in Chicago was awesome -- nobody would ever imagine otherwise. But I was totally freaked out to learn that three days later, the debit card I'd used to cover any incidental charges still hadn't released the W's $200 hold, and as a result, I became inadvertantly overdrawn. Naturally, I totally freaked out. But after a few deep breaths, I phoned the hotel and was immediately treated with ALL respect, and my call was forwarded to a miss Shumeka Bonds in their accounting department. Shumeka listened carefully to my complaint, and I could even hear her pen scribbling notes as I was talking. She asked politely if she could phone my bank and get right back to me. I was skeptical, but agreed. Could you die??? She actually called me back in less than 15 minutes and sure enough, she'd spoken with my bank manager, and the entire snafu was resolved in less than a day. In this world of feeling that great big huge nameless, faceless corporations run absolutely everything and don't give a damn about the "little people" like me, it was overwhelmingly delightful to deal with Miss Bonds and all at the W, who treated me as though I was a celebrity. More pleased with my experience I simply could NOT be!!! Thanks, Shumeka, and thanks W! Kaia, Chicago Illinois

Reviews.Title: “Hip Vibe, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Donatella-Bingbong
Reviews.Content: Nicely decorated & clean. Spiced hot chocolate & smores cookies help to take the Chicago chill off. Fortunate enough to have an upgraded room which was quite large with queen bed & chaise lounger. Fitness center clean & up to date with cool towels in the fridge. Super comforable bed & pillows. Linens where squeeky clean. No pool.

Reviews.Title: “It's a W...”
Reviews.Author: rhgill
Reviews.Content: I am required to stay at this hotel every time I'm in Chicago -- not too bad I think. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and chic -- albeit a bit on the small side. Ditto with the bathrooms (for a standard room.) The hotel is in a historic building, so it has a cool vibe. The bar area is kinda small, at the front of the hotel, but good. My problem with this W, and all W hotels in general -- is that they are dark and disorienting. I don't want the club-feel, but there you have it. The service at the front desk was okay. The service of the food staff was helpful and excellent. It's a fun place, but I'd probably pick something less "cool" if I were staying in Chicago. It depends on the experience that you want.

Reviews.Title: “We were "Those People!"”
Reviews.Author: KristenZee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W City Center for two nights over Labor Day Weekend in 2011 (I know, late getting around to writing this review!). It was amazing to see how the other half lives! Everyone we encountered at the hotel treated us very well, from the person who parked our car, to the AMAZING concierge Eden Bernal. Eden - you have EVERYTHING to do with why we loved our stay! Thanks to Eden, we were able to skip ahead of a line at Lou Mitchell's that was easily 45 minutes long. Oh yes, we were THOSE people! Eden also got us tickets to the Shedd Aquarium ahead of time, again saving us a very long wait in line. Anything the concierge can do for you, he or she will do for you happily! We were very happy with our ultra-modern room that faced the alley. It was by the El, but wasn't too noisy. We did mention our desire to rest to the woman who checked us in and she seemed to accommodate us. The room was small but really, really nice. All the lights were on dimmers. The under-bed lights made the bed look like it was floating! There was a generously sized closet with nice hangers and a light, and even a couple of shelves. We had a slow-draining tub and found a tee shirt from the previous guest in a dimly lit corner, and in both cases someone came right up to take care of it for us. The linens were soft and warm and the windows could be opened to let in the fresh air from the unusually lovely fall day. It was too bad that all the add-ons were so expensive (the wine in the room looked good, but not for that price!), but we loved what we had. Our other slight disappointment was how early the hotel bar closed. Midnight? I guess everyone there goes elsewhere to bar-hop, but we would have liked to sit down and enjoy a night cap. Around these parts the party goes to 2 no matter how remote the location. We stayed here for a friend's weekend and were very happy to be just about a block away from an El station. We could get out to the wedding in about 20 minutes. Yes, you can hear the train, but it makes for wonderfully short commuting times. We took a bus to the Shedd Aquarium, and that was very easy and inexpensive. I think we might have walked 4 blocks to catch it. It was very reasonable. The walk to Millennium Park was a little longer, but as long as you wear reasonable shoes and dress for the weather you will be just fine. Walking around Chicago is one of the nice things about the city. If you are against walking, again, the El is right across the street, and the door person would be happy to hail you a cab. The final touch to our weekend was that they allowed us to leave our car in the parking lot for an extra few hours while we toured a museum after we checked out for no extra charge. We were pleasantly surprised, especially since parking can be so very expensive in Chicago! It was a wonderful trip. So wonderful, in fact, that we are going back to another W this February! We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “W = WOW ... So pleased with the service and experience of the W City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Whitney C
Reviews.Content: Chicago has always been one of our favorite cities in North America, and because of our experience at the W, it is now at the top of our list. From the moment we walked into the hotel, although located central to the financial district (about a 5 min cab ride to Magnificent Mile, 25 min walk), we were greeted by one smile after another. The staff at the W were exceptional, especially our concierge Vanessa; she brought an extra bit of light and life to our total experience. From perfect dining ideas, to hospitably welcoming us, going above and beyond any of our expectations, Vanessa is a clear asset to the W group of hotels - We definitely recommend the restaurant "Coco Pazzo" - terrific Italian dining. Iâ€™ve had the opportunity to stay at many W hotels all around the United States, and the W City Centre had by far the best service. In addition, the rooms were spacious, clean, and cozy, with a lush and contemporary feel. The bar and lounge were illuminated by a sleek and relaxed vibe â€“ the perfect atmosphere to just wind down. All around, we owe the W a great deal of gratitude for making our weekend that much more perfect.

Reviews.Title: “W Lifestyle May Impair Rest”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMidwest
Reviews.Content: I am SPG Plat and booked this hotel on points for a trip with my wife. First, the "W Insider" was absolutely fantastic and helpful. Her name was Laurelin. She gets five stars. The hotel location is great and just steps from the Orange Line to Midway. The property is fine and has that W feel. Some like that vibe and others do not. The vibe tries to be dark and clubby. I think either one likes that sort of thing or does not. I am now nearing 40 and while I used to like it I am now more annoyed with it (that is on me). Having the guy on the Mac acting like a DJ now seems silly--but that may be just me. I have stayed in W's in Seattle, San Diego, New York and both in Chicago. In each of those properties I have had trouble with guests in neighboring rooms coming home at 315 am like clockwork, cranking up the in room stereo and continuing their night. I think the W seems to attract this type of guests more than other hotels. I am no prude but getting distrubed every night at 315 can sour you on a place. Granted, you can get disturbed at any flag but it seems to always happen at the W--again maybe it attracts the people that party all night. In any event, I think the hotel facilities and experience are average. However, the W Insider did her job--she can't control the crowd the hotel attacts. One more thing--we were on a high floor but with no view of other buildings and felt nicely insulated. However, we could hear traffic whistles from the street and the L. It was not bad (you are in a big city so you expect noise) but I would imagine it may be different if you are on a low floor. For example, the room at the City Center was louder than a room on the 15th floor overlooking the street at the W Union Square in NYC. Take that for what it is worth.

Reviews.Title: “What a great trip!”
Reviews.Author: mary s
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a fabulous weekend stay at the W City Center. We booked the W because it was close to the Christmas Market at Daley Center. The W was a short 4 block walk. I was a little leery when I first walked in with my 9 year old son, it looked young, hip and funky. However, there were wooden chess sets, connect four and checkers games sitting out even hot chocolate at check in. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. There were a couple of small broken things but the staff was very apologetic and very attentive at getting them fixed. The shared spaces in the lobby is comfy and fun. A great alternative to being stuck in the room. One night we decided to go down, have a drink and play some chess. My son was sad because all the games were gone. I asked at the desk and they said someone threw all the games pieces together and they sorted through all of them so he could play. Amazing customer service. The restaurant is nice and has great food. They were also very accommodating to my son. There is also water and coffee for free in the mornings, and cookies out in the afternoon. Also plenty of options right outside the doors. But I cannot say enough great things about the staff! Thank you for such a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE IN W CITY CENTER”
Reviews.Author: eduardo n
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience. we had an excellent service , the people who works is very nice and they are very concerned about you. LAURELIN HEFTER, from concierge is very very special in order to keep the details in you stay , anything you need she will get it!!!! i recommend a lot this hotel, and also is in the financial center. good luck.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Anita H
Reviews.Content: I live in Milwaukee, WI and work in Chicago, so stay in the city frequently. I had stayed at the W City Center several times for work, and chose this hotel for recent weekend get-away with my husband. We love the chic vibe of this hotel, excellent service and attention to detail. I requested the courtyard and they upgraded us to a Spectacular room when I asked upon check in. They have re-decorated the rooms and I liked the fresh modern feel. If you stay in this part of the city, you need to know that you'll be walking or taking a cab most places, but I appreciate the proximity to Union Station, and you can get almost everywhere in Chicago via cab for under $8 if you don't want to take the trains or buses.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the financial district”
Reviews.Author: suzdCA
Reviews.Content: The w is located right off the el train so there is some noise, I am not the heaviest sleeper but I did not have a problem sleeping. The staff is great and they have partnered with Acura so there are free rides around the city if pre-arranged. Overall a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: nervesound
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic stay at the W - the service was amazingly friendly and the room was stylish and comfortable. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Launch your trip from the best hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn W
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure, my experience was incredible. The location is ideal for shopping, great restaurants, and all the sights. The staff at this hotel have been trained to respond immediately, thoroughly, and creatively to every request. The rooms are clean, spacious and have every technological support for your computer, cell, and any other device you brought along. Housekeeping quickly took care of several requests. The bed was really comfortable. The dining room offered some interesting selections that I have not seen elsewhere. In fact, the chef was testing some new items which were delivered to our table gratis for sampling. Ask consierge Landon for advice on absolutely everything and anything. His knowledge of Chicago and willingness to help made my stay a memorable one. I will definitely choose this hotel for my next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: aparna l
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my 4 yo for 2 nights using starwood points. I called ahead and was told that they would have a stroller for us to use but when we got there, they did not have any strollers available. Rosa at the front desk not only upgraded us to a better/bigger room but also made arrangements to buy a stroller for our use! We went out to get lunch and by the time we got back, there was a stroller waiting in our room. In many other ways, service and attention to our comfort was excellent. The room and the hotel were airy, clean, spacious and the location was perfect - short walks to the art institute, millenium park and excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Ive stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: Love this place, From the trendyness to a pretty decent location, I would love to stay there again. Ask for Laurelin in the concierge service, she is amazing and really knows where everything is and all the hot spots to hit. Rooms/beds were amazing, cozy, and most importantly clean... Def. Going back!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel service EVER!”
Reviews.Author: michellepryer
Reviews.Content: This hotel's concierge service was unbelievable! Laurelin was who helped us with everything from dinner reservations, car service, ideas for things to do around the city and even hooked us up with a coupon to the restaurant we went. The atmosphere in this hotel was very trendy, sleek, and modern. My husband and I are in our upper 20s and enjoyed ourselves very much for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place to stay”
Reviews.Author: princesslizzie
Reviews.Content: If you like shopping at Abercrombie &Fitch, you will like the W Hotel. You enter the hotel and you a greated by a dark, funky atmosphere (not the half naked guy at A&F but it has the same feel). CHeck-in staff are very friendly and helpul. The background music here can be a bit of an issue as it is very hard to understand what the check-in people are telling you. The room I had was great , it was almost the size of an appartment and not one of those rabbit boxes you normally get in big cities in the States. The room was very clean and so was the bathroom ( I am very picky when it comes to bathroom cleanliness), no stray hair from former guests, a big plus ! The bathroom amenities are top standard, all from bliss spa with conditioner (most hotels save money on this one) and even a facial wash !!! I had a room on the 5th floor facing Adams Street and the only noise you could hear was the aircondition, switch it off and you are in heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service & a great "W" hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hasmit R P
Reviews.Content: This is a great W hotel !! I have stayed in many W hotels. Loved the Service. The W City Center Concierge Vanessa "runs the extra mile" as a true Concierge does. Very friendly & excellent service. Camille from IPO at the W City Center puts a smile on everyones face. Two Thumbs Up for a hotel that was 100% sold out. I felt at home away from home and highly recommend this W hotel. I am very picky as a frequent traveller but Vanessa & Camille derserve a compliment. This will my Chicago Hotel whenever I am in Chi-town. Of course the place is very dim. That's the W concept and brings calm back after a busy day. W hotels are unique and W Chicago City Center stands out ! for me 5 stars plus!

Reviews.Title: “W @ City Center Rocks”
Reviews.Author: mike g
Reviews.Content: As you walk in you notice the bar and how convenienct and cool it is. The lobby and second floor are luxurious and comfortable, which is very hard to accomplish. To top it all off, the custiomer service is fantastic; everyone rememebers your name and greets you so nicely, the concierge staff is very knowledgeable, helpful, and makes reservations everywhere for you. I love this hotel and will be coming back a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: travel0ve1
Reviews.Content: Very hip hotel. As you enter you feel like you are walking into a club. The place is very dim and the bar seems very busy. You have to walk passed all the people in order to reach the front desk. The rooms are contemporary feel. The valet overnight was overly priced at about $69/night, but all the valets in downtown chicago are outrageously priced. The location is a walkable distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience and decent location”
Reviews.Author: RussYYZ
Reviews.Content: You're in the heart of the city (with a free car ride to the jazz clubs and restaurants of Rush St. if you want) and it's just a nice place. Enjoy. We did and will do it again. Most amazing of all was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice trendy room, but slightly awkward”
Reviews.Author: removeyourshoes
Reviews.Content: Like all of the W Hotels, this hotel is hip and trendy. The room is small, but sleek. The platform bed had underlighting, there was a speaker for my ipod, and the Bliss shampoos and soaps were provided. The room was small and a bit awkward. The toilet was not centered, and was placed right next to the tub. This made entering the shower awkward. Also there was a large (46 inch?) flat screen tv, but it was not aimed at the bed and remote did not work correctly. The room was clean and comfortable. There is a nice cafe and bar in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The W - stands for out of this "W"orld”
Reviews.Author: JanetBandoy
Reviews.Content: Where do I start! I LOVED everything in this wonderful hotel. The ultra chic atmosphere to the exceptional W staff. I especially loved the big quote in our room - "Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself". This sign alone set the perfect mood for my stay in the beautiful Windy City! And wow, I fell head over heels for their bed...I really slept like a baby :) And I can't forget to give a HUMONGO shout out to their ROCKSTAR Concierge Supervisor, Landon Moore! He totally took care of me and made my stay ultra special.

Reviews.Title: “Concerige Insider Vanessa Lopez Provides Exceptional Customer Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: ravi_lally
Reviews.Content: I routinely stay at W hotels and must say the W City Center never disappoints! I approached Vanessa Lopez at the Concerige desk with the difficult last minute task of getting my friends and I into Paris Club (hottest club in Chicago) for the Halloween party the next day. We also we seeking last minute dinner reservations at Sundae, another Chicago hotspot. True to the W motto of "Whatever Whenever" Vanessa was able to get us set up for both. She also provided us with additional ideas of places we could go Friday night. We had an amazing time in Chicago thanks to Vanessa. We look forward to staying at the W City Center again!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Style, Ambience, and Service”
Reviews.Author: NYCfudlover
Reviews.Content: I'm from Chicago and have travelled on several occasions there for business. I stayed at the W on Adams for another reason - run the marathon and stay near the start. The Lakeshore W feels kind of bland and I expected the same from the W on Adams. In fact, it was even more beautifully decorated and had much more style and ambience in the main room. The lovely fresh apples, hot chocolate, and water for guests and gatorade for post race was a nice touch (in the main room). Service was also impeccable and rooms were clean. The walls are kind of thin (we heard kids in the next room over) but I can't complain; I had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great W Property”
Reviews.Author: goat521
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the W Chicago City center. Both of my stays have been excellent. A friend had recently stayed at the W Lakeshore in Chicago and said he had a great time. This time I was in Chicago I took the time to check out that property, and although it is very nice, I prefer the W City Center. The building has character and the staff are very friendly. We came in late one night and started a conversation with the "welcome desk agent" Anthony Ortega. Even at 2am, he was friendly and seemed really excited to be at work. We spoke with him about some of the other W properties that we have stayed at and he offered us a great perspective on the W brand. I travel frequently for business, and have stayed with various other hotel chains. Few of them offer the service and professionalism of the W, while still being personal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent concierge service”
Reviews.Author: SAA1Toronto
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference and it was my first time in chicago. Definitely wanted to check out the scene as well. Eden, Laurelin and Landon were exceptional in sorting out dining plans and late night plans. There was a bit of a hitch trying to get in to Studio Paris the one night. Miscommunication somewhere. But other subsequent arrangements made up for it. They made the trip quite excellent. I can't thank them enough. You'd have to stay there because I won't share those secrets. The Acura service is also a great convenience and asset if you need to be dropped off somehwere within a 5 mile radius in style. I'd do it again! Thanks W!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Cozy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: minnow1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for two nights for a wedding (also at the hotel). Other reviewers are correct - the rooms are small. Smaller than I anticipated even after reading the reviews. We were in several other guest rooms while there and they seem to vary in size and lay out, you may have luck requesting a larger one when making reservations. What this pad lacks in space in makes up for in style and service. Each aspect of the guest rooms were thought out and there is creative space planning and design, the decor is modern/contemporary but not over the top. I did find the halls and common areas to be super dark...you feel like you're in a nightclub 24/7. Overall everything was very clean and the staff was so so nice. If you are thinking about planning a wedding for this location - do it! The setting was beautiful and the staff was so attentive and friendly. We were so impressed by the bar service and table service once we were at dinner. Everyone went out of their way to make sure your stay and evening was memorable. We didn't eat in the restaurant but hung at the bar both nights and it was a fun place and pretty 'happening' for a lobby spot. Service here was great too. At one point our keys became de-magnetized, as I was going back to the elevator to go to the front desk someone on the service staff recognized me and practically chased me down the hall to help me. She let me in our room and then requested the front desk send up new keys, which were then in hand in less than 5 minutes. Wow. This is a great hotel, for the price, we'd probably look elsewhere in the future though. It wouldn't be a great place to take a family looking to stay in one room - we wouldn't have even wanted to have our newborn with us as a crib would have really crowded an already tight space. For a romantic getaway or shopping with mom or the girls it's a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Nannarpite
Reviews.Content: I've read reviews of other W hotels that refer to the haughty attitude of staff members and, to be honest, I thought this was going to be the same case here. How wrong I was! Every single member of staff that I encountered was so friendly and so accommodating. They had no airs or attitude about them and, if you can even imagine, actually appeared to like their job!! What a refreshing change! I got a very spacious queen room that faced the courtyard. It was clean and well appointed, though the bathroom was a little on the small side (I was traveling alone on this occasion, so it wasn't an issue, but couples may want to request a room with a slightly larger bathroom), and I had to call down for a coffee maker. Other than that, the room was great and I really love those Bliss products! I also really appreciated the 'Acura Experience' where you can get a complimentary ride in a very nicely equipped Acura vehicle to your destination (I think it was up to a 3 or 5 mile radius of the hotel). That was a very enjoyable bonus. So too was the option of not having the room made up and receiving Starwood points instead. I think this is a fantastic idea and even though I chose to take advantage of this offer, Guest Services were still more than happy to send up extra Bliss products for me. The only thing I did not like about the hotel was how thin the walls are. The person in the room next to me received a call at 5:30am and, not only could I hear the phone ring(I actually thought it was my phone), but I could also hear almost every word of their conversation. Later that evening, I could hear the alarm in the same room, going off every 10 minutes. That was rather annoying and is the reason I gave the hotel 4 rather than 5 stars. Actually, I would only have deducted half a star, but that isn't possible on TripAdvisor. Overall, I would return to this hotel and would recommend it other travelers, but just be sure to ask for room away from other guests.

Reviews.Title: “W City Center Chicago...good spot”
Reviews.Author: janine k
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and very attentive staff!! Clean, neat, modern rooms. It's in the heart of the business district, which has it's pros and cons, depending upon the reason for your visit. The one thing that made it special was the staff...they really went out of their way to make sure our visit was excellent. And I noticed they paid attention to details.. In particular, Laurenlin...she followed up with an email after our reservation to ask if their was anything we needed...AND she actually followed through with our requests. Those details made our stay worthwhile!

Reviews.Title: “Nice alternative to cookie cutter hotels”
Reviews.Author: 42492Escamillo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W recently and had a great experience overall. Yes, the room are a bit small but very clean and the staff is really friendly. Plus the location is ideal-I will definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Mom and girls trip!”
Reviews.Author: leese1078
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from celebrating my daughters 6th birthday in Chicago. My 2 daughter, one friend and her mom were all excited for this trip, and the W hotel made this trip PRICELESS! Our concierge,Laurelin made sure no detail was left hot from sprinkles cupcakes to W gift bags with nice cards for each girl and Garretts carmel corn! Laurelin delivered the American girl Birthday doll and made my daughter feel extra special! A carriage picked us all up to take us to her Birthday dinner at American girl. The other Mom that traveled with us was blown away at how kid friendly the hotel was, how beautiful the hotel is, and how the staff is willing to help make anything possible!

Reviews.Title: “Best service”
Reviews.Author: slew_11
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Chicago for the marathon and was welcomed with generous goodie bags before and after event! Awesome dinner accommodations at IPO; the night before the run we just wanted what we were used too so the chef made EXACTLY what we wanted, thank you Jamie for the flexibility. After the run the house keeper on our floor, Regina, gave us enough ice to fill the tub for a most rewarding soak! Bed was comfortable and room was VERY quiet. Personally I would put some more lighting in the room, it was a little dark. Best service we have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: amihaic
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one week. The room was exquisite, the bed was really nice, the TV was great and the bathroom was very spacious and well-lit. The hotel itself looks like a great choice for couples visiting chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms with EXCELLENT Service”
Reviews.Author: DineWithDani
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Chicago for business. I lobbied and fought to stay in a W Hotel because it is a brand that I trust. This property definitely did not disappoint. We arrived on my birthday and they were kind enough to upgrade my room. When i got upstairs- I was slightly disappointed with the size of the room, but as it was just me alone- it worked. The sink in the tiny bathroom was small, but here again- it did work for one person. As for service, I requested foam pillows, but the room came with down (i did upgrade at the last minute). So i called to have the pillows exchanged- someone was knocking on my door with new foam pillows within the minute. Yes the minute. Same with the coffee pot the next morning. When they replaced the pot- they gave me one that was the wrong size. Again, within a minute I had a new pot. And for ambiance, the W is known for the gray, purple and white interiors with moody lighting. My lobby and rooms are no exception. The creative lighting in the room was amazing, what i thought was just wall art was actually a light fixture. It made me love the space even more. The elevators at this hotel almost made me feel like I was slightly high. The loud, pulsing house music and kaleidoscopic, 3D jewel wallpaper made my colleagues want to close their eyes. I just enjoyed the ride! The night we checked in there was a party in the lobby. There was a model in an over-sized martini glass at the center of the lobby, the upstairs bar had a human vending machine, the drinks were free during happy hour and the dj played the best music. This was a great way to kick off a weekend of work. My favorite topic is the food: As is par for most business trips, my meals came from the hotel. They were SUPER pricey, but very very tasty. If you like oatmeal, you will LOVE theirs. The location of the hotel is not ideal. It is in the financial district, so most things close early and there aren't many entertainment options within walking distance. But cabs are awesome. PS- Parking is cheaper in the public garage across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for W”
Reviews.Author: Oursdur
Reviews.Content: The pros Nice concierge desk, however not manned after hours. Not too far from Marathon departure area. The cons Small rooms considering the price, paper thin walls (baby crying next door can be heard), poor maintenance, low level of service from laundry (late delivery, no efforts made to meet client requests ), no international channels on TV

Reviews.Title: “Will even go down an elevator shaft for whatever, whenever!”
Reviews.Author: Geri G
Reviews.Content: Yesterday evening a precious keepsake earring, given to me by a friend now deceased, fell down the elevator shaft at the W Hotel. Panic.
