I asked for help retrieving it (but I did not really fully expect a search of the bottom of the elevator shaft--it is a lot to ask). How wrong was I? Laura, the Concierege had Engineering dig down the shaft and later that evening they told they could not find it. I was grateful they looked, but awfully sad. But this morning, on checkout, I was told that Joe Meany, one of the Engineers, had gone back to have second look and, miracle, found the earring. I cried, I was so surprised and happy and grateful. Manager Brian refused to accept a reward for all the people involved in the effort (though I channeled something to Joe), which underscored that what they did was part of their philosophy of customer service. This all goes to show me that beyond the trendy veneer, the fancy slogans is a hotel that means what it says and goes above and beyond. That was some exceptional customer service. Tonight a big vote of thanks to Laura, Brian, all the Engineers and particularly to Joe Meany, who gave me back something I cherished.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: AddyJ
Reviews.Content: From the moment I entered and till I left, the customer service was outstanding. Everyone was extremely courteous and helpful. The ambiance of the hotel is also very modern. Overall I had a great experience staying here. The Staff, especially Laurelin, were always willing to help out. They were actually willing to do Whatever, Whenever I asked. Even after I checked out, Laurelin went out of her way to find an item I left in my room and bring it to me in my cab outside, as I was getting last for my flight. I'm certain that this hotel has the most helpful and cheerful staff in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant/Jazzy”
Reviews.Author: a t
Reviews.Content: Landor Moore set us up with all the best resturants and places to go in Chi - town - he was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Consistent with the whenever whatever promise!”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedBusTrav
Reviews.Content: My stay started with Eden, the concierge, welcoming me and providing an upgrade plus a welcome drink. It continued with outstanding service and quality throughout. I will definitely plan to stay here again when I visit Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel Chicago City Center”
Reviews.Author: Suresh P
Reviews.Content: So good that I am going back this weel! The team in the W is really outstanding! Impeccable service. Particular mention to the Concierge Team of Eden, Vanessa, Lauralin - they booked everything that we needed and gave great recommendations. The front of house guys were exceptionally helpful! Location, service and attention to detail were great. Would highly recommend this hotel as the rooms, restaurant & bar were all great. I am a new fan. Kind regards, Suresh Punjabi

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, great rooms, great experience”
Reviews.Author: jhatax
Reviews.Content: The W City Center's staff is friendly and go the extra mile to help you feel at home. The hotel is very conveniently located in the heart of downtown, and most restaurants are a short cab ride away.The amenities are top notch, the rooms are spacious (if you get upgraded), there is a restaurant, a bar and a great lounge area to chill or have meetings. If you're visiting in the winter months, don't miss out on the great Hot Chocolate that is served by the check-in area.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered and Posh, always fun in the big windy!”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: The W had been my home away from home for many months. The people, location to work, amenities and techno appeal all add up to a nice little package I call my week. Lobby, although it looks smaller than it really is, can be enticing for a late night chat or pre-work business conversation, filled with enough corners and table space to accommodate any type of encounter you are looking for. The people are exceptional, greeting you with a smile and all seem eager to help. I know many of them by now and they take the extra step to help every guest have the best possible stay or set of stays. Location is a bit of a tough one. During the week it is extremely convenient for work and transportation, with access to the CTA, bus and walk to work. Also, you are often able to grab the Acura free-ride service to shuttle you around Chicago (within 5-miles). For a weekend stay, it can be a bit tricky as you will most likely be cabbing it home to downtown or spending additional cost to get to and from your destinations. In my opinion, still worth it. Overall, I cannot recommend this place enough. Always a good scene, great service and attention to detail. Unfortunately, you will find some of the trapping of a higher end hotel, like expensive in-room food and water. but, you are in a city, I an sure you can find a reason to run out and grab your own snacks! Enjoy your time there and hope to see you passing by in the lobby...

Reviews.Title: “Poor service from accounting”
Reviews.Author: GRLTRAV
Reviews.Content: A review should take into account your entire experience with your hotel stay, and this hotel gets demerits for it's poor service from the accounting department and the noise associated with the L. For my needs, the hotel property has a good walking location to the business district and a $10 cab ride to/from some of the city's great restaurants. The rooms are up to the standards that you'd expect from a W hotel - very comfortable bed and comforter, modern bathrooms with Bliss products and plenty of fluffy towels, flat screen tv and sofa/sitting area. The room value can't be beat, but beware, some of the rooms can feel the vibrations/rumblings of the L. My experience with the accounting staff, was less than stellar. When I received my AMEX bill, I had some charges on it that didn't belong to me. Calling the hotel main number, you're transferred into accounting, and 100% of the time the phones ring into voicemail. I left a voicemail. I left two voicemails. I had the hotel receptionist try multiple A/R extensions for multiple days. I couldn't get anyone to return my calls. I finally got through to the manager, Jean, and she was less than helpful. She started by telling me that they log every call, and that they didn't have any messages from me. The tone of her voice and the words she chose to use were not customer service-like, and certaintly not representative of the W brand. As there are many other fine hotels in the city, I've chosen not to return to this one because of my experience with accounting. Note that I have taken off 2 stars related to my interaction.

Reviews.Title: “Alice in Wonderland--Without the Mad Hatter”
Reviews.Author: MidwestBoomer
Reviews.Content: In the center of the lobby are two objects that look just like table lamps. Yet, instead of being 2-3 feet tall, they are 20 or 30 feet tall. Add to that a couple disco balls with rotating light patterns projected on the walls amid a sort of electronica music. You can see why there's something of a feeling of being Alice in Wonderland when you walk into the lobby. A major difference: The level of service gives you exactly the opposite of the distressing feeling that Alice got from the Mad Hatter. Example: A big appeal is the set of Bliss toiletries in each room. I asked the concierge about buying more. There's no W Store at the W City Center, but she directed me to the Bliss spa at the sister property in Chicago, the W Hotel Chicago Lakeshore. (Tip: Be very careful not to confuse the Chicago City Center property with the Lakeshore. They are at least a couple miles apart and in very different neighborhoods with very different feels.) Well, the concierge went a few steps farther. She printed out directions to the Lakeshore. She reminded me of the Acura MDX that is often available for short trips for guests, checked on its availability, and walked me over to the Acura desk. Within minutes, I was cruising to the Lakeshore. This was my fourth stay at the W Chicago City Center, and I could regale you with other stories of that high level of service that exceeds every other hotel in which I've stayed in the US--including stays at Ritz-Carlton and Four Seasons properties. There was the time I was thinking of buying a CD with some of their electronica music, and I stopped in the hotel shop. The sales clerk spent a good 15 minutes asking me about my taste in music, playing excerpts from different CDs, and even suggesting a blues club I might enjoy! The hotel has changed since my first stay a few years ago. No longer do the front desk clerks check in guests with computers using candlelight for auxiliary lighting. Instead the Welcome "desk" is a series of red podiums. The corridor isn't the dark passage that some found scary; it was brightly lit. The towels were quite adequate--but not the super-fluffy ones that led me to order a couple sets for my own home. They didn't have music playing when I checked into my room; but there was a flat screen Philips tv with a beautiful picture. Although the hotel is very stylish--the elevators are dark and moody with music playing, keep in mind a few issues: The rooms are small (but certainly tolerable for one person). My view was a courtyard with buildings, which is not very impressive. (Tip: Chicago has a lot of trains, including the "El." They can be noisy. So . . . sometimes a dull courtyard view can mean a room with some of the train noise blocked.) The fitness center had only one elliptical machine--but the aerobic equipment was well equipped with fancy screens for watching tv and inputting personalized programs. The hotel is barely a block from the Quincy-Wells El station. This can be convenient, but watch out if you have a lot of luggage: There's no elevator at the station. You'll need to walk up stairs to moreless the third floor level. A 7-11 and a Walgreen's are close by for basic sundries. The hotel is in a part of downtown Chicago dominated by large banks. It's not a bad walk, though, to the Art Institute. This was my fourth stay (or maybe I've stayed even more times--I may have lost count). So you can tell that I love this hotel's style and service. I have Marriott gold elite status, but I didn't even consider staying at a Marriott on this trip. That's how impressed I am!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kat B
Reviews.Content: I spent my Birthday weekend at the W and right off the bat I knew it would be a great experience since the concierge, Laurelin, sent me an email giving me options for a night out in the town. Upon arriving in my room, I was greeted with a nice Birthday greeting and red wine and chocolates! It was an overall great experience and I can't wait to return! The only drawback was that my friend sent a Birthday present for me at the hotel, and he wasn't told that there would be a $7 package fee :(

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mafonia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding and it was one of the best places I've stayed. We had a standard room and it was perfect for two people. The bed and pillows were so unbelievably soft I never wanted to get up in the morning. The bathroom was a generous size as well. The staff was great and always helpful, and the location was great for wandering around and close enough to the trains that you didn't have to walk miles and miles. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location-but pricey”
Reviews.Author: CinMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel-excellent service. Use the concierge-they are knowlegeable about the area and give great directionsm. Rooms are nice (we stayed in a 'spectacular' room. Walls are thin. It was in a great location for first time visit to chicago. We may have been expecting a little more to the room for the $.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kasee L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W City Center over Labor Day weekend. We had a great experience...the staff was amazing. Be sure to stop by Laurelin at concierge desk...she is the absolute best! She gave us great city suggestions...got us reservations at a fun restaurant (Urban Sushi) make sure you check it out! The rooms are a little small, but they are clean and the beds are awesome...not much for you can ask for. I would suggest it to anyone....go check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to Stay when working in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: LeftyWilbury
Reviews.Content: I try to stay here whenever I have a work committment in Chicago. The central location allows me to easily get to surrounding downtown offices by foot. The hotel lobby is hip and a good place to grab a quick drink with colleagues or clients. The rooms are modern and the ones I've stayed in a pretty good size, although I've heard the lowest level rooms are small. Compared to other cities, the nightly rate is usually pretty reasonable at this hotel. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good and not so good”
Reviews.Author: stephsamps
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I expected a little more from the W. I have stayed at quite a few before and they have usually been top notch. The room itself was nice, but the bathroom was a little surprising. The tub had multiple chips in it and there was writing/graffiti on the bathroom wall that they tried unsuccessfully to remove. Definitely wasn't what I expected from the W. The lobby was a little crazy around happy hour, but was very nice as the evening wore on. If you are going for a meeting in the West Loop, this area is fine, but otherwise the North Michigan area is much quieter and has a lot more to offer.

Reviews.Title: “excellent price performance”
Reviews.Author: a h
Reviews.Content: One of the most pleasant features of W Chicago was the concierge, Ms Laurelin Hefner. Ms Hefner is not only efficient , but charming, witty and understand perfectly her questâ€™s requirements. Her energy and constant attention to details is remarkable. Finally , she manages to keep her good mood and humor under the worst of circumstances. Yours sincerely Alexander H. Hamilton

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but overall stay okay”
Reviews.Author: bostongal19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W City Center for the first time to attend a friend's wedding nearby over Labor Day weekend. The rate was great ($160/night), and with the hotels.com free night, we ended up getting a great deal. Even if we had to pay full price, the W would have been fine, given how economical the price was. The room was pretty clean, but the size was just too small - even for two people used to city living and close quarters. I would say the room was comfortably no larger than 12' by 10 or 11'. The bathroom was absolutely tiny, but the real inconvenience was the lack of sink or shelf space for toiletries, etc. Bliss products were great. The water pressure was fairly weak though. My fiancÃ© (a fairly light sleeper) turned up the AC to create background noise that he hoped would drown out the subway train noise coming from not too far away. The W hotel brand in general caters to younger, trendy travelers, so the lobby that pounded Euro/techno music was no surprise. Still, it's not for everyone. The location is not ideal for the average Chicago tourist who wants to walk around the Mag Mile and Gold Coast areas and venture north. If we were not bound to the wedding and had options to stay elsewhere, I would have preferred the Park Hyatt or the Peninsula, which are my two favorite hotels in Chicago. The W is fine for a short stay if you are okay with cramped spaces and noise issues.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Engagement and Birthday”
Reviews.Author: Anna S
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the hotel was beautiful with fresh modern decor and great fragrances. The room was outstanding with roses, and chololete strawberry waiting for us. All which was prepared by the greatest concierge named Eden. Eden made the room even better for my birthday. The next morning Eden assisted us with tickets to see the Sky Deck and direction to the park. She was so friendly and very helpful. That Million Park I got engaged. My fiance and Eden work together to make sure his proposal was perfect. I was blown away. There was nothing I did not love about my stay at the W Hotel. I cannot wait to come back. It was so relaxing and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good. But you do pay for it”
Reviews.Author: skotle
Reviews.Content: What is your expectation of this kind of hotel? Well, the W in downtown Chicago will definitely achieve it but, boy do you pay for it. $8 for a bottle of water in the room! Everything is excellent (well, the breakfast was a little slow) but excellence is expected in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Grandro
Reviews.Content: The W awakens the senses and blends well with the greatness of downtown Chicago. Laurelin was great and offered excellent tips on how to enjoy a short stay. I enjoyed dining at IPO, the hotel's restaurant. My only complaint is that the snacks in the room should be complementary.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience...”
Reviews.Author: pjnazari
Reviews.Content: My stay in Chicago was wonderful, and the staff @ the W was definitely part of it. Especially Laurelin Hefter making me feel comfortable with a capital C. Thx, Paul Nazari

Reviews.Title: “I am probably not going to come back.”
Reviews.Author: joann f
Reviews.Content: My stay at the W City Center was fine. It was not amazing or horrible. Laurelin helped me through email before I arrived in the city. She set up a car service to pick my bags up from another hotel because I was in a wedding and had not time to transport my bags, or check in. I needed a roll-away bed in my room and was told by Laurelin that it would be there when I arrived. It was not there and when I asked for one I was give the answer "It wont fit in your room". When I realized there was definitely enough room I told the man helping me and he replied "I don't think we have any left anyway." My account was also authorized for an addition $200.00 upon arrival which I was not informed about and still have yet to receive back into my bank account. I do not think I would stay at the W again. This could have been easily avoided if the roll away bed that I requested a month in advance had been in my room, or if the man that helped me had a better explanation than " I don't think we have any more anyway." And If I had been pre-warned that my card was being authorized for an addition $200.00. The Acura service that picked up my bags was definitely a huge plus though!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but the disco theme was over the top.”
Reviews.Author: QueenMemphis
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W hotel with friends. We booked the room through hotwire and ended up having to pay additional fees to get a larger room. Be forewarned that if the standard room on hotwire is for ONE bed. The hotel's location was not ideal. We were hoping to be a little closer to Michigan Avenue. Pros: The staff is very friendly, helpful, and professional. The rooms are clean, have ample lighting and very comfortable beds. We had a room with two double beds. From what I understand, these rooms are twice the size of a room with one bed. We had plenty of space. Complimentary car service was available. The hotel offers complimentary Acura car service between the hours of 1PM to 8PM within a 5 mile radius of the hotel. It books up fast, so you need to reserve the car as soon as possible. Cons: the lobby and elevator are too dark. Now, the lobby is very trendy. It looks like you are stepping into a disco. But it looks that way 24 hours a day. I absolutely hated the disc decor in the elevators. You could get dizzy just riding up to your floor. It all looks good, but it's over the top for a hotel that does not sit in a busy area of downtown. The hotel is perfect for younger couples or singles who are looking to party. I would prefer a little more lighting and a location closer to the Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped but cool--Nice option in downtown Chitown”
Reviews.Author: Brett E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for a one-night business trip and really enjoyed it, though it's hardly a formal, business hotel. The W is great if you're young or want a cool hotel in downtown Chicago. The location is really fantastic, and the staff was incredibly nice. The lobby of the W has a hip, Euro vibe. It hardly feels like a hotel lobby. At times it feels like it's trying a bit too hard--the elevators are dark and it's hard to see the floor numbers--and the rooms come with life-affirming posters on the walls. But I think the W is an experience--something very different from the run-of-the-mill hotels out there, and for that I say kudos! Be aware that the rooms are extremely small. I see some of the pictures posted here, but don't be fooled! The "suites" may be big, but the regular, one-bed rooms are tiny. It feels a bit like Manhattan in the rooms. Perfectly fine for 1 or 2 people though, and it's kinda cozy. Everything was impeccably clean. Lastly, the breakfast downstairs in the morning was awesome. I remember the coffee being really good.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway from 'cane Irene”
Reviews.Author: brett s
Reviews.Content: Great weekend at the W City Center in Chicago - Laurelin Hefter and the rest of the team at the concierge desk recommended a lakefront beach, shopping area and some breakfast options, all of which we loved in addition to architecture and sightseeing tours and more. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andi29
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast in the restaurant was a good option.

Reviews.Title: “1980's Sheraton with Room Service”
Reviews.Author: colnagoroadie
Reviews.Content: I am Starwood Platinum member, and have stayed at most W hotels in the country. I would love to know why Starwood allows this hotel property to be named a W. It hurts the brand. It hurt my head for a day and half. Decor terrible. Rooms small. Doors hollow. Commodes explode. Everything is small...so the good - it was clean and room service was good and food consistent with most W's. Sorry Starwood - but this was a big miss.

Reviews.Title: “So much hot pink...”
Reviews.Author: EmJDavis
Reviews.Content: A fun place to stay, but by day three we were sick of the hot pink lighting, club music, and disco lights! This place makes you feel like you're in an episode of "sex in the city!" The holograms in the elevators made us motion sick every time! Very attentive staff and friendly service. Quiet room with large TV.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: sunjammer1
Reviews.Content: Was here on a conference for three days (if you're a business traveller, you know how grueling that can be), and the entire service staff (particularly Kelly M at the front desk), went far beyond the expected level of customer service to make sure the stay was comfortable. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Coolest hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: brudawsky
Reviews.Content: My husband and i were in town to run in the Rock n Roll Half Marathon and a great location and a comfortable room were very important. And the W was perfect for both. Within walking distance of everything that you need when visiting Chicago. And the lobby can only be described as WOW! I couldn't stop looking at it every time we walked through. Our room was incredible and huge and had so many really cool features. The staff was super nice and we really appreciated the late check out so we could rest after our race before heading home. We did notice the noise from the L train nearby but it was not so annoying that it disrupted our sleep but I would recommend bringing a sleep aid if you are a light sleeper. And having Giordano's stuffed crust pizza a few blocks away for that post-race meal was a bonusl!! Highly recommended - we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “I love the "W" chain and Chicago didn't disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: Runlikeaclydesdale
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for pleasure for the Rock N Roll Chicago 1/2 Marathon earlier this month and stayed 3 nights at the W Chicago. I was traveling my sister so we grabbed a larger room with two double beds. The room layout was bright, spacious, very clear and very modern (typical W like decor). Found the aircondition to be extremely loud and room noise to be above average, but you are in Chicago where its loud all the time anyway (Honk honk beep beep.) Laurelin at the Concierge desk was spectacular at recommending hip spots for dinner and nightlife where we truly had the experience of the Chicago culture. I would definitely stay here again or try the other W on lakeshore to mix things up a little.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and upscale place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: vegasgirl777
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel and it was marvelous. When I walked in I thought I was in an upscale lounge. I had to wait for my husband, so I relaxed upstairs on the second floor overlooking the entrance. The couches were plush, clean and extremely comfortable. After we checked in, the bed we so cozy I didn't want to get up, but we were in Chicago, so we had to explore. The night before check out, the concierge printed our plane tickets and had them waiting for us in an envelope at the desk. They also had the best cucumber water I have ever tasted!

Reviews.Title: “Second time around good as the first”
Reviews.Author: Travelotely
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in two months staying at the W City Center in Chicago and I would return a third. There are two W hotels in Chicago. One is nearby the Lake Front. This review is for the hotel on Adams Street which is in the business district. There are some complaints about this property in other reviews about location and noise. The location is in the business area. During the evening, it is not especially busy because it is not a neighbourhood. If you are accustomed to urban living this should not be a problem for you. The area is not unsafe, but you might see the occasional homeless person or vagrant. Other reviews mention noise from the "El" which is the elevated train track which is a good half block away. On the first time I stayed at this hotel, I was in room 1004 facing Adams Street and the JW Marriott across the street. I heard no noise. I have lived in Central London, NYC and Philadelphia and city noise is not bothersome to me. This stay I am in room 1815 which is a larger room than 1004 and overlooks the interior courtyard. There is no view and other rooms are directly facing. But there are very adequate blinds to ensure privacy if you need that. This room is also incredibly quiet. Frankly, I am not sure how anyone could hear the "El" trains half block away. I scored the room cleanliness low for this visit because on Friday and Saturday the room was not properly cleaned -- at least not to my liking. I am fussy. I emailed the general manager. She replied immediately with an apology and promised to look after my issues. She followed through immediately. She emailed me while I was out at dinner to say that the issues I raised had been addressed and she would like to know from me if it was satisfactory when I returned. When I returned from dinner, my room had been cleaned and my issues fully resolved. There was a fine bottle of red wine along with a fresh cheese assortment and fresh flowers. Very nice touch. This property does not have a spa. They will organise an in room massage if you like. Or we took advantage of the "Accura Experience" to go to the Bliss Spa inside the W Lakeshore. Bliss is a nice spa but nothing over the top compared to the great high end spas in the world. My massage therapist, Jose was outstanding. He gave me one of the best deep tissue massages I've had. The breakfast is quite good however, I like breakfast in the room in the morning and it is too expensive which is why I gave it a "3". Food is very good and arrives at the correct temperature; the coffee is also good. The price is much too high. There is a wonderful diner out the front door and left about 2 1/2 blocks which I highly recommend. Waitresses are excellent and very good quality breakfast for a very good value. There is in room WiFi but again for a 6-night stay and every night is a new charge, it is too expensive. I would prefer it bundled into the rate. But for this stay, I was able to score an incredibly low rate so I can't complain about that too much because it is overall a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with lots of Energy!!”
Reviews.Author: CherylhHomerGlen_IL
Reviews.Content: Came in for the air and water show, decided to stay at the W because we are spg members and love to stay at our club hotels. Have to say, it is a gorgeous hotel. Very stylish with a bit of sass. We were greeted and checked in by Fatima and Rick, both of whom were just wonderful and very helpful. We checked out with Kelly and Zach, again we were greeted with warm smiles and positive energy. Even housekeeping was very pleasant and greeted us whenever we walked by. The rooms are great. Nice size, lots of amenities. We had a less than great view of another building, but it was fine for this trip. Love the bathroom set up which is convenient for getting ready. Lots of counter space. Bed was very plush and cozy. Loved the decor as well. Wish I would have known I could have a coffee maker in the room. Missed that little memo and went to Starbucks. Oh Well, next time. Bar area is nice to grab a cocktail. Wish there were more appetizers on the menu but what we had was decent. The bartender-Lindsdey was great. Mixed me up a custom Mojito that was not on the menu and got it spot on. Felt bad that the bar was so busy and she was alone. There could have been a waitress on duty on a Saturday afternoon. Our experience at the W was a great one. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I am now a Raving Fan of W due to staff, especially Devin DeAngelis”
Reviews.Author: Martin R
Reviews.Content: I travel all the time. I have never had a hotel experience like the one I just finished up today. Your front desk person, Devin DeAngelis, was incredible. The entire staff was iimpressive, but she in particular shown like the star she is. She made me feel wonderful, welcome, and special. She is friendly, outgoing, caring, warm, sensitive, energetic, professional: in a word, superb. I hope you make sure she is aware of what a fantastic impression she makes for herself, and the hotel.. She is going places in this world, so I trust W Hotels will cultivate, reward, and retain her. She is special. In fact, I was so impressed, I am seriously considering switching from my Hilton Honors (Diamond Level) to Starwood properties, based solely on this two day stay at W on Adams. Eden, the concierge, also deserves special mention, as a few others whose name I cannot recall (or never got).

Reviews.Title: “Great W experience...as usual.”
Reviews.Author: bellaRN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W Chicago City Center on a recent "fun" trip to Chicago. We love W hotels and this particular location did not disappoint. Very beautiful rooms (we stayed in a corner suite), great service, and good location. This W has an awesome living room space- very trendy yet super comfortable. We spent sometime one evening just lying on the couches- having drinks and chatting. We did find that the Acura experience option offered was not as convenient at this location compared to other W hotels we have visited. We found that things were much more spread out than expected, leaving us unable to use the Acura for drop off...also, Acura experience only available from mid afternoon to early evening (I believe it was 1330-2030). All in all, nice stay. Would certainly stay here again the next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Typical W - Great - But can get expensive”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: After a 2-month work commitment in Chicago, I've stayed at this hotel 3 times, as well as several other Starwoods in chicago. This one is the closest to my work and definitely a solid option, but can get very expensive. It's your typical Starwood and lives up to those expectations. I always have a message waiting for me to help with anything I could possibly need during my stay. Be careful about the Fiji waters if you're an SPG member. I was told one per day was free, but apparently it's only the small one which is NOT what they leave out for you. Anyway, they were nice enough to take it off the bill. I haven't spent anytime in the bar or restaurants and one downfall of this location is that most of the restaurants cater to the lunch crowd so finding anything outside of the hotel can be hard. I've eaten at Berghoffs (okay for take out, probably better if you eat it there) and found a few other spots after walking several blocks away. The rooms are good here though, big TV and lots of channels, comfortable beds and multiple lighting options (which can get a bit complicated!) I've always had plenty of space to do yoga (they have a yoga mat they'll loan you). I'd stay here every time except that it can get very expensive when conferences or events are in the city. Probably not the best location for tourists either.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great!”
Reviews.Author: ThatOneItalian
Reviews.Content: Always a pleasure staying at the W. The service is prompt and thorough. Our concierge Laurelin Hefter was excellent. Very knowledgeable, helpful, and friendly. With customer service like that... I have no desire to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “First time at W”
Reviews.Author: KConsult
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a W hotel. If you haven't stayed in one before, I highly suggest! This place makes you feel like you're the only person that matters, they aim high to please and try to use your name whenever possible. Everyone at this hotel is exceptional. From check-in, bell boys, housekeeping, and concierge-they all impacted my stay. This is by far the nicest hotel that i have stayed at. Note that I a platinum at Marriott but chose the W Instead. The place is hip and trendy. As for the view, they have done the best they can with the space. I can't wait to stay at the W again!

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blondie_713
Reviews.Content: i loved my stay at the W City Center. As soon as i walked in i was welcomed by a addicting aroma; i knew i was in the right place. The lobby's decoration is very chic and sophisticated. I also like the fact that it caters to classy young adults/ professionals. My room was a good size room with fun kits and coasters, i thought it was inventive of them. At night the hotel is buzzing with people hanging out at the bar, to me that was not a problem at all. I don't know how other people would feel about that. As far as the hotel being kid friendly, i don't know if they are but i didn't see any kids during my 4 day stay. Although the hotel is conveniently located right next to the El, i didn't hear the train at all while i was in my room. It didn't disturb my sleep. The hotel is also really close (about 2 blocks) to the Sears Tower. The only pet peeve that i had was that the restaurant/bar closes early. Yes i know there's room service but when you are in the need of a snack and wanting to get out of your room, you're only left with 2 options Dunkin Donuts or McD's since all the stores/ restaurants close early in that area of the city. Oh, and the hotel doesn't have a pool which that's something they should think about adding! Other than that, my stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “very mediocre but great staff and excellent cappuccino”
Reviews.Author: passeportLondon
Reviews.Content: Have been to a few W's and thought it would be a cheap option for 1 night, wrong. After hiring a car and driving from O'Hare we found there would be a $53 overnight car parking charge. Outrageous the most expensive parking we have ever paid!!! The decor of the hotel is very trendy dark colours, it looked nice, the reception is a bit like a disco reception with pink fluorescent trendy! or garish! The lift ok stop, when you get in a lift and your eyes cant focus there is a problem, the purple holograms and the dim lighting made you feel you were in some sort of vegas nightclub. Every time we went in the lift someone commented on how awful it was. I don't drink but if you do I suggest take the stairs. I don't wear glasses and I am not old, please change your lift. Breakfast was in the restaurant which was really nice except the breakfast wasn't apart from an excellent cappuccino, a minute croissant that had been radiated, which I sent back, Ill tell the chef! Then toast came which was damp warmed sliced bread! They apologised they refunded. I would rather have had a decent breakfast as we had a 3 hour drive ahead of us. The staff were really great though, and I did have a good nights sleep in a very comfortable bed. shame, we won't be back.Retrain the breakfast chef and sack your decorator.

Reviews.Title: “Get the spectacular room: for expected quality”
Reviews.Author: ski-fanatic-73
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week for business. The location is great when you work / have to be in the Sears/Willis tower area. Destination within `the loop` are walkable; but the Millenium park is already close to 15 minutes. I have read a lot about the smaller wonderful rooms. I have seen one briefly and indeed I was happy with my 'spectacular room' (nice W marketing-names). The rooms was fine for quality standards. W has great beds, but that you know when you go to W. The bathroom was typically US style: the showers are really not near the level of the modern European hotels (with the rain showers). Having a 42" tv with about 40 channels is relaxing in the evening. My rooms was cleaned nicely everyday as it should be. Then there is the Fiji Water. Apparently something which is in fashion in the US. In the 7-Eleven around the corner (there are 3 within 3 blocks) have it for 2,50, in your room for 8 USD. And they put 1 in your fridge, 1 on your desk and 1 in your bathroom, just to remind you. Yes it is service, but is it even higher than the 4,50 euro in W Barcelona. Wifi. I was there in July 2011. You can find free wifi everywhere in a normal city; if you can't find it you go to Starbucks and have internet incl coffee for a few bucks. In the W you pay 15 usd per day for wifi. Come on people... it is really 2011... I have not been to the restaurants nor did I order room service; for some reason I did not get interested by what they have to offer compared to what Chicago has to offer. And just to mention: there is indeed loud 'W' style music in the Lobby. It has to be your style. So, it is a nice, fine, good hotel. Please compare the prices for the '2nd' grade of rooms. If you like the price and you have a purpose to be in this area, you will probably not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great service as always...”
Reviews.Author: MikeZeller
Reviews.Content: Laurelin provided great personal service, which made my trip that much better in a city that I very much enjoy visiting for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jbracy01
Reviews.Content: The hotel was veyr nice & so was the staff. Especially the concierge, Eden Bernal!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING SERVICE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: texastraveler012011
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely beautiful and the service we had was first class! The concierge service was impecable! Anything we wanted to do they would make a call or go online and book for us. We didn't have to worry about a thing! I would definitely suggest this W to anyone....and we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: CSL230
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at the Hotel (was in town for a music festival.) Staff was very friendly. The concierge desk is very attentive; they contacted us a week in advance to see if we had any things we wanted to book in advance, unfortunately they couldn't get a dinner reservation for us at the Girl and the Goat but everything else they did was great. There were a few mix ups with a room change / stay over for us - and after getting locked out of our room twice it did get resolved (just took a lot of time for their error.) The hotel location is great. Took the train in from Midway - the stop was one half block away. There isn't a lot going on in the financial district around the hotel during the weekend but that was fine with us - less street noise and it was still very easy to get to everything. It is a several block walk to Millenium Park etc (got in a couple good early morning runs along the waterfront). Also their car service (via Acura) is good for being dropped off - but book early, as it was completely booked for the evening when we checked in at 4;30 PM.) Original room was interior court yard view which was supposed to be quieter. Unfortunately it was directly across from the eleveator and so we moved to an exterior room on a high floor. With the exception of one siren vehicle in the early hours street noise was not an issue. Had a two bed room and it was very comfortable, bathroom was great and everything was very clean and well maintained. The first floor has bars and restaurant and walk through it to get to reception. It is a fun young vibe but not for everyone. Had dinner at the bar one night - the bar tender was great but the kitchen was very slow (decent food.)

Reviews.Title: “hip and trendy sans attitude”
Reviews.Author: JonAntony
Reviews.Content: would recommend this hotel to any who appreciates a good asthetic. Aside from the great looks and funky vibe of the place, the staff was most curteous. Further, This place is clearly a destination place for the after work crowd as the bar and lobby ( doubles as lounge area) were packed after 6. The bar also get a great evening crowd. Although very youth oriented judging by the clientelle, this 40 something was still well recieved. So, when in Chicago stay here, indulge, and be sure to leave the children at home.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST concierge”
Reviews.Author: fvrbtmn
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the W Chicago since October 2010. The service was also very good. I loved 2 things best - the IPO restaurant and Laurelin Hefter at the Concierge. She was always cheerful, helpful and found the best places to eat. Thanks again the entire W Chicago team. Arthur

Reviews.Title: “Attention to every detail, top quality”
Reviews.Author: sdwylie
Reviews.Content: The W Chicago is one of the smartest, well designed hotels I've ever stayed in. The chic, stimulating personality of the hotel was refreshing and energising. The design seemed to cleverly consider every aspect of the hotel - the scent, temperature, ambient music, lighting, artwork, food, and even the language used by the staff at check-in. I was impressed with the attention to every detail, and the significant attempt by the W Hotels brand to make every part of the experience feel unique and interesting. For instance, the bed which appeared to "float" above the ground by using clever recessed LED lighting, the embossed bath mat, or the bar of soap with extrusions on the base so it didn't go soggy. The restaurant and room service offerings were both exceptional, with refreshing Asian and French influences of fresh, simple ingredients and delicate presentation. The gym was open 24 hours, and the equipment was modern and in great condition. The bowl of apples and chilled towels in the fitness centre were another welcome touch. Unfortunately, during my stay, I had issues with unreliable Internet access, and wasn't able to get online for the first night of my stay. This was rectified on the second night.

Reviews.Title: “Breather Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: ljbLongIslandNewYork
Reviews.Content: Having stayed and enjoyed W hotels on prior trips, we knew we would get high drama decor, a well-designed room with a great linens etc., good food and attentive staff. The Downtown W in Chicago delivers all that. However, if you are in any way allergic, asthmatic, or annoyed by strong candle smells... this is not the place for you. The "signature W candle scent " is very strongly present as soon as you enter the lobby, the restaurant and bar areas also. Staff was very accommodatiing and quickly removed the candles near me during dinner- but it is everywhere. The scent is present but not as noticeable in the rooms, luckily. Also take note that the rooms are somewhat like a beautiful jigsaw puzzle- meaning you need to move one thing frequently to get to another. All very tasteful, but when you literally have to squeeze your hand into an area to flush the toilet- someone made a few tasteful miscalculations....

Reviews.Title: “Love Starwood Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: skip12883
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently traveled to Chicago and spent 4 nights at the W City Center. When we first arrived, we were concerned that we weren't close to Navy Pier, but it didn't really seem to matter. We used their Acura Experience car a few times to take us to dinner and a Cubs game at Wrigley Field. The Acura Experience was excellent, the drivers were all friendly and it was a beautiful car! I would highly recommend using that service. We also just learned to walk everywhere, sometimes miles a day and I think that's the real way to see any city. We're from NYC so walking doesn't scare us. Our hotel room was very clean. The hotel lobby has a sort of lounge feel to it and there were usually a good amount of people hanging out there every evening for happy hour. If you're an SPG member and you opt out of housekeeping daily you can earn extra SPG points. We also used the exercise facilities which had good equipment and a very clean workout space.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, Excellent Service & Location!”
Reviews.Author: LC12349092
Reviews.Content: Hotel was awesome! Sexy, modern style, on a weekend night you might think you are in a nightclub when you are in the lobby! Bar was awesome, blonde female bartender (cant remember name) was friendly and kept the drinks coming...probably why I cant remember her name. Ate at IPO (hotel restaurant) for breakfast, loved the choriza chicken breakfast burrito! Laurelin, the concierge, gave great dinner recommendations and also gave info on what bars to hit and provided managers names in case we had any trouble getting in on a busy Saturday night. Room Service (chicken sandwich, burger) was fast and good. Overall, cant say anything bad about this hotel. Within walking distance of the Mag Mile and tons of great restaurants, shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great City"”
Reviews.Author: johncon2785
Reviews.Content: The W hotel was great. Laurelin provided 5 star service booking us dinner reservations, club reservations and also getting us Cub tickets. She made our trip to Chicago seemless and lots of fun. I will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_Of
Reviews.Content: Wanted to give the guys at the concierge desk special mention. They were very knowledgeable and extremely enthusiastic and helpful. Laurelin Hefter in particular gave us some great restaurant advice and pointed us towards a comedy show that was a blast. Its worth staying here just to get access to these guys. Andrew

Reviews.Title: “Eden Bernal- Best Concierge Ever!”
Reviews.Author: kizwiz1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location in June and July of 2011. Immediately upon book the reservations I received an email from Eden Bernal offering assistance to accommodate my trip. During both stays she provided assistance with reserving excursions such as a city bike ride, car and dinning reservations and connected me with a great personal trainer. Most recently, during my dinning experience at Epic (which she arranged) to our surprised the waiter provided complimentary champagne courtesy of Eden. As a young professional who travels monthly, Eden's professionalism and kindness are cherished!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice; small spaces”
Reviews.Author: notsowickedwitch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for three nights, in a room grade the hotel calls Spectacular (middle of their room classes). The hotel is very cool and the staff very helpful. They have a big after-work bar scene and early weekend evening bar scene. And the bar had a lovely Prosecco! Our room was very, very clean and the bed comfortable. Housekeeping did a great job every day. Drawbacks - the bathroom was small for two people (more later) and the closet was awful. In the bathroom (furnished with nice Bliss products) the toilet is in a separate little closet. I'm 5'2" and my knees were four inches from the wall when sitting. My husband had to sit sideways! So if you're tall, you should ask about this feature. The closet was very narrow, and midway down the room safe projected from the back wall. So there was no place in there to hang a dress. Oh, and the advertised ironing board in the room is really just one of those desk-top sleeve board-type things. These are details to know, but not details that would keep me from going back to this hotel. The location was great for getting out to Michigan Ave, but still being a bit removed.

Reviews.Title: “WHY”
Reviews.Author: Ajsaraf
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the W Hotel at 5 PM after traveling all day, when I arrived I was told my room was not ready. When I asked for an estimate of when it would be ready I was told between a 1/2 hour and two hours they were not sure. I had dinner reservations at 6:30 with a client and was not offered a room to get ready in or anythig but a drink at the bar. I travel all the time and I a stay at Starwoods all the time, I have been a Platinum member for as long as I can remember. I was very disappointed in this hotel, the service, the management and the whole experience. I understand being busy and being sold out but you must have the staff who can handle these situations. I will not be back

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: MariaVillaevic
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for a friend's anniversary party. The hotel is just the typical W. Hip and funky decor. The lobby area was too dark for my taste. Comfortable sitting area, too loud in the evening when the young crowd arrives to impress. There are a lot of young ladies outside the hotel later at night waiting to be invited to come in. Good value, helpful and professional staff. Free tea and pastries in the evening. This is in the financial district so pretty dead on weekends. We didn't book the Lakeshore location which is closer to all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, room, experience!”
Reviews.Author: RickHe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to the W City Center to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary. It was both of our first time staying at a W, but (hopefully) not the last! From the moment we walked in we were made to feel incredibly welcome: from Justin and the entire Welcome team who upgraded our room (sweet!), to Eden our concierge who not only booked us a last-minute reservation at Wildfire, but also directed us to the Acura desk for a free ride to dinner in a brand-new MDX (nice!). Only to top this off with chocolate-dipped strawberries and a bottle of wine waiting for us when we returned! Thank you guys for an awesome anniversary stay! Rick H. Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: eloali
Reviews.Content: This was probably one of my most relaxing vacations. The W is extremely inviting and the staff was superb. I have to mention specifically a young woman named Vanessa Lopez because I tasked her with doing the impossible... and she did it!!! I didn't have to lift an entire finger the entire trip because Mrs. Lopez and a colleague found me every restaurant, musical and club reservations throughout my entire trip. The room was very comfortable and the location is unbeatable. I recommend staying here over any other hotel I have stayed in Chicago. If you see Mrs. Lopez or Derek (one of the waiters), say hello!

Reviews.Title: “Great service & experience @ W City Center”
Reviews.Author: quinnbartsch
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 1st wedding anniversary trip to Chicago. A couple weeks before we even arrived, I had received an email from Eden, the concierge asking us if she could make us dining or activity reservations. She was so helpful from the get go, even prior to us arriving at the hotel. Once we got to the hotel, we met her and she was as friendly as I would have imagined. She even sent up a bottle of prosecco and chocolates as an anniversary gift. She was on top of her game and was extremely hospitable. We also enjoyed the Acura experience they have at this hotel. It is very convenient to have nice transportation (and free) to wherever you like within 5 miles of the hotel. Make sure to make your reservations because on the weekends, the car books up fast. Our driver was very friendly and also helpful. The rooms were nice, very modern as all W hotels are. Our experience here was great, we walked everywhere thanks to how centrally located the hotel is. Would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Eden Bernal made my trip fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: landscape35
Reviews.Content: Eden went out of her way to make sure I had an excellent stay at the W. She was very helpful with suggestions on places to visit, and with tips on areas to take photographs. The hotel staff was very friendly and catered to my every need. The room service food was great, as was the IPO restaurant and the bar. I had a very nice stay, and owe much of my excellent visit to Eden. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous way to celebrate in style!”
Reviews.Author: Oddeninona
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of friends in August for my birthday weekend. I couldn't have been more pleased with the W. The hotel was absolutely glamorous. My girl friends and I were in love with the interior design of the entire place..including our stunning rooms! The staff was very helpful with all of our questions and need for suggestions. They even surprised me with a bottle of wine and dessert for my birthday! They are wonderful at thinking of all the little details to make a stay enjoyable. From the Whenever, Whatever service to the complimentary Acura car rides, they thought of it all. The W is in an excellent location to local attractions too! I couldn't say enough great things about this place and will continue to stay at W hotels from now on whenever possible.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service Staff Make You Feel Pampered and At Home”
Reviews.Author: ajlshopper
Reviews.Content: From the time we drove up to the W the service that the staff provided was exceptional. It was an overnight stay in Chicago, short but sweet. I've never stayed in a hotel that was luxurious and still made me feel at home. The only bad side was the room service food. The fries were defenitely too salty, but considering it was near midnight when we ordered it, I can't complain much. Plus, we did receive it promply! The rooms were very spacious, and the beds were comfortable. The other best part, besides the service, was the Bliss toiletries and not having to ask for extra towels. It was a memorable weekend, including my stay here!

Reviews.Title: “The W did everything they could to accommodate my family although their focus was business. My children felt special the entire”
Reviews.Author: AmandaBT
Reviews.Content: Laurelin assisted us with tickets, tours, reservations, and special treats for my kids. She was awesome, organized, energetic, and efficient! I suggested using the W concierge!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have done it without Concierge Desk!"”
Reviews.Author: amandams0613
Reviews.Content: I took entertaining and education tours, ate at great restaurants, saw city sights, and hit nightlife that I would never have been able to know and coordinate on my own and so having a knowledgable, accessible, and friendly concierge desk made my Chicago experience priceless! Specifically, Eden Bernal, Landon Moore, and Vanessa provided fabulous service. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFloridaGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W during a recent business trip. The hotel staff was very friendly and pleasant. My room was available upon my arrival even though I was very early and did not request an early check-in. The room provided was a matchbox! It had to be the smallest room in the hotel. After communicating my dissatisfaction, I was told the hotel was sold out and I could not be moved to another room. However, Rachel, my concierge, made everything right. She moved me to a larger room and comped me a few drink coupons for my troubles. The hotel itself is hip and sexy, typical W style. The onsite restaurant, IPO, is nice - tasty entrees. The gym is functional and there isn't an additional cost to use it - unlike the Westin St. Francis in San Francisco. The W is located in the Loop area of Chicago which is convenient to shopping, Garrett popcorn, and site seeing. The only gripe I have about my visit is the hotel attempted to charge me $100.00 for a mini-bar fee. Of course, I never used the mini-bar so it was easy to dispute this charge. The staff was very apologetic and removed the charge. However, when I checked my cc statement days later the charge reappeared in the total bill. After several calls to the hotel, the charge has been removed. All in all, a good stay at a cool hotel. Words of wisdom, check your bill before check-out and keep an eye on your cc statement after your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: WanderingSusan123
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positive. The staff at the W city center was so friendly and professional. I don't think we opened a door the whole weekend. Loved the uberloungey lobby with the giant white sofas and loud techno music. The design is quite lovely in the public areas if you like an interesting mix of historical architecture and modern design, which I do. The room was just ok. It was plenty big and had comfortable furniture and bedding. The design was very sterile though, all white. Probably, I was comparing it to some of the lovely modern hotels I had recently stayed in in Austria, and found it lacking. The location is great for business (right by the big banks and so on in the loop) and also a short walk to the theaters, art institute, and State Street shopping, but something of a hike from the other touristy bits north of the river. It was fine, but I probably would choose another option in the future, for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A mix of old and new.”
Reviews.Author: leeinply
Reviews.Content: From the outside, the W looks like a quaint, traditional, older hotel...but when you walk through the doors you find a modern club-like experience. Even the decor in the elevators is a juxtaposition of old-fashioned brass and ultra modern 3D art. The rooms are spacious for a downtown hotel, and are decorated in a very modern vibe. The service in the hotel is top notch. The beds were great! The location in the city is wonderful...easy walk to many places. We were here for a wedding, with the reception being held on the balcony and in a ballroom at the W...the reception areas were decorated in grand, formal, traditional style- couldn't have been nicer. We had a great time at the W!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property!”
Reviews.Author: Ralie
Reviews.Content: In just a couple of weeks my husband and I will be returning to the W Chicago-City Center because we had such an amazing experience there when we visted this past April. From the moment I arrived, I was greeted with such hospitality from at the reception desk. Without even requesting, Justin upgraded my room upon arrival. My room had everything I could possibly need. My husband took a later flight than I did, and because of bad weather, his flight didn't get in until 2am. When he finally arrived, at the front desk he was greeted by Michael, who personally assisted him and escorted him up to our room after a long night. The next day was my birthday, and Umberto and Jose from In-room dining set up a beautiful tray of chocolate cake and champagne that was sent to me by TK from the front desk! And the concierge service, Laurelin and Landon are unbelievable! They know Chicago and can recommend the trendiest and best restaurants as well as sights to see. The location is right in the heart of the city close to the "L" , buses and Metra stations. Oh, and they have what's called the "Acura Experience". A complimentary shuttle service in the newest Acura luxury mid-size SUV. They will take you to restaurants or any location within the downtown area! This is a hotel staffed with young, smart, energetic and upbeat people who know how to make you feel at home and well-cared for. Can't wait for our return trip!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay here for business.”
Reviews.Author: Orb
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at how Business-friendly this W hotel was. My room was very well lit and had a very ergonomic desk/chair set -up for working. The staff was very responsive and the location was excellent, close to lots of shopping, public transportation and restaurants. Really the only thing I'd quibble with was the annoying music they played in the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay and service”
Reviews.Author: NHSH
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many SPG properties and one thing which stood out with this hotel is the amazing service we received - especially from Laurelin Hefter. If I return to Chicago, I would definitely stay at this is hotel just because of her. Laurelin actually contacted me prior to our arrival and asked me what is the purpose of my trip and what she can do to make my stay as comfortable as possible - this totally made me special. Laurelin also planned our nights and every place that she recommended was A+. Rachel at the front desk greeted us with a smile and was very professional. The rooms which we got were spacious and clean. Overall it was an amazing stay at an amazing hotel A Big Thanks to Laurelin and all the pleasant staff at W. Looking forward to return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “WOW WOW”
Reviews.Author: WOWWOW71
Reviews.Content: WOW WOW WOW WOWâ€¦â€¦â€¦. If you want to relax, belong, feel special, THE W CITY CENTER IS THE BEST PLACE TO unwind. I stayed at the W City Center on Business for 5 nights. I booked my reservation one month out, about one week before I was due to arrive at the property, I receive a email from Hefter Laurenlin, asking me what is the purpose of my trip and what she can do to make my stay as comfortable as possible. (WOW WOW WOW) I felt very special. Upon checking into the Hotel I was greeted by Kelly one of your Welcome Desk Agent who had a very pleasant attitude and welcome smile. She also give me a brief overview of the hotel which I thought was great, then she told me to wait a few minutes she has and envelope for me, I said to myself whatâ€¦. No one knows that am here, The envelope contain a greeting letter from Hefter and information about the city, (WOW) so after the checking process I was heading to the lift and was greeted by Vanessa â€œwhat a talentâ€�. I asked her where is the nearest CVS store, she stated to me what are you looking for she would be able to assist me with my request. During the five nights I was there I had several other requests and which Vanessa assisted with and follow up with me by via email, voice message on just in passing to let me know that my request was completed. I felt like a King during the five nights I was there, the team really goes above and beyond to make you feel home away from home. But I must say Vanessa and Hefter really when above and beyond to make me feel special. This was my first time in the Big City and at your property and it will not be my last. OH. one other thing I wanted to mention. I ate in IPO for dinner three nights during my five night stay. IIII LOVEEE Pepsi, after I was seated by the hostess the waiter said can I get you something to drink, I reply a glass of Pepsi she said that they did not had any Pepsi they only have coke, I said coke was find, on the second night dinning in IPO I said I will take a glass of coke, another waiter came back and said here is your Pepsi I said WOW WOW WOW how did he know, (he did not tell me just smile) he was not even the waiter on the first or second night. That is what you call whatever/whenever service. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at W Chicago - City Center is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: KellyG2000
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Chicago - City Center for the first time and have to say I was wowed! Soon after I booked my reservation, my "W Insider" Laurelin Hefler personally reached out to me to invite me to consult with her on my plans for my stay. She and the entire staff were absoluetly amazing! The level of customer service I received led by Laurelin made me feel as though I was the only person staying at the hotel. The smiles, personal touch and knowledge of Chicago were superior. I cannot wait to return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: Wynner0019
Reviews.Content: Had an absolutely amazing trip to W City Center Chicago this past weekend. The service was amazing and the staff was outstanding. They were very accommodating to the needs of my girlfriend and I. It was our anniversary and every one on staff seemed to know and took personal touch to make sure our stay was excellent. Laurelin Hefter was one of our favorite staff members because she genuinely cared about us having the best experience possible.

Reviews.Title: “What a great downtown Loop location, comfortable lobby and great people.”
Reviews.Author: Ap2305
Reviews.Content: Melissa Rank, Jamie T, Nicole Kusper, Jamie Torres, Patricia Brown, Tonya Williams and Humberto Cruz were all so helpful and nice. Thank you for a wonderful evening.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel W wasn't so Wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: llkasll
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at this hotel for my birthday weekend. The description of this hotel sounded right up my ally. We get there and have problems from the beginning with they way they kept trying to charge my credit card. Music was too loud to hear what any of the front desk people were saying. We get into our tiny room and discover writing on the walls. A hot stuffy room with a air conditioner that barely works. A few of the many expensive snacks in the room had already been opened by previous guest and I was hoping my credit card wouldn't be charged for them. The design of the lobby and vibes that were thrown off were really nice. I just wish we hadn't ran into the issues we had. Full Review can be found here - www.--------------------.com/2011/04/w-chicago-city-circle-hotel.html

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at W Chicago City Center”
Reviews.Author: Tania019
Reviews.Content: For those who are planning their trip to Chicago I would highly reccommend this hotel...Everything was perfect..location, rooms, very friendly staff..Will def. come back here...Want to thank Laurelin Hefter who made a great job...getting all the details in advance and help in all possible ways to make our stay unforgetable! thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: cpdaughe
Reviews.Content: A great W hotel in Chicago. Better than the Lakeshore Drive one. Rooms are new and fresh. Service was really good. Great concierge who was very helpful in finding restuarants and bookings.

Reviews.Title: “The "W", our wonderful weekend away from home!”
Reviews.Author: bernardjalteri
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, everyone was not only helpful but went the extra to make sure we felt special. Guess what, we did! One person in particular, Jamie Torres, (I believe her title is IPO Greeter?) went out of her way to make us feel at home and our stay memorable. Everyone greeted us with smiling faces no matter what time of day or how busy they were. Our room was comfortable and everything we needed was quickly taken care of. We will definitely visit again and will recommend the "W" to friends and family visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “W for WOW”
Reviews.Author: NicoleS_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to the W Hotel this past weekend for our 3 year anniversary from Indianapolis. All I can say is WOW. From the moment I started cooresponding to our "W Insider", Laurelin- I knew this was going to be a wonderful trip. I have never received such wonderful customer service from another hotel ever in my life. We are pretty big travelers too. Laurelin sent wine and chocolates to the room and not to mention got us a hotel reservation at Girl and the Goat a few hours before. If you are from Chicago, you know that Girl and The Goat is a fairly new restaurant and the first available reservation was September 2011. She got a reservation that evening, 8:30pm on a Friday night, a few hours before. Not to mention, called our room to make sure that we were well informed. The restaurant was simply magical. That reservation made our anniversary by far. To simply have someone so attentive, detail oriented, and actually cared for the guests staying with her establishment says a lot, truly. I manage a spa in Indianapolis and customer service is everything. It impresses you from the moment you book your hotel to the second you retrieve your car to head home. Every step of the way was crisp, efficient, and done with true kindness from all of the staff. I appreciate such wonderful customer service as we will definitely be back. Laurelin, you made quite the impression on behalf of the W Hotel. You made the W Hotel a wonderful stay for us, and both Ian and I thank you so very much for everything. A wonderful 3 year anniversary it was....WOW. Thank you again, Nicole Schmoll

Reviews.Title: “IPO restauraunt at the W chicago”
Reviews.Author: bdobler
Reviews.Content: Ate dinner at IPO, which is new restaurant at the W. Great food. ordered the grape salad, and the seared ahi tuna. The grape salad was light and tasted great. Great salad for upcoming tuna. The tuna dish was very good. Also ordered their carrots (side dish). It is not like your typical carrot side dish. It was incredible. For Dessert, had the gelato trio. Service was great. Waiter was James. Very helpful and pleasant staff. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT service”
Reviews.Author: jleebc1
Reviews.Content: the staff and concierge are world class! i did not have any idea where to go to dinner but they promptly setup 2 great dinners, a ride by the acura service(free service that the hotel provides), and tickets for a show. they were incredibly friendly, knowledgeable, and accommodating, i would highly recommend the W in chicago to anyone! although other resorts offer similar accommodations, the service at the W blows all other hotels out of the water!

Reviews.Title: “It was great night's sleep at a hotel that made you want to stay up all night.”
Reviews.Author: Webbert11
Reviews.Content: The hotel and all of it's staff were impeccable. The facility has a great vide and is lively, but still cozy enough to allow for a great night's sleep. Laurelin and the rest of the staff were incredibly helpful and I had a great time during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay - Avoid hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidihn
Reviews.Content: Why this was terrible stay: - Broken TV - I complain that my TV doesn't work. It takes them over an hour to send someone. Once the service guy comes, he says he will let the front desk call me once fixed. No one called and TV was never fixed. - Tiny rooms - I stayed at this hotel for 3 weeks because my work forces us to stay at this hotel. You would think that they would provide their frequent guest with the bigger rooms. Nope, not here. Rooms are tiny! - I never asked for a wake up call, but they call me at 6AM to wake me up with a wake up call I never asked for. Not only did they do this once, but TWICE!!! Two days someone wakes me up at 6AM! - Room Service - I order room service and waited about an hour. So after an hour, I call to see where my food is and they tell me its on its way. Another 20 minutes pass without food, I call back and they say they have no record of my order. They finally send food 20 minutes later. But of course, they screw up my order and don't even send what I ordered. To sum up. Hotel never owned up to their mistakes and never apologized. AVOID the hotel. There are a lot of hotels nearby, so you should AVOID it at all cost! I stayed at other W hotels, but this was just beyond bad!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at the "W" thanks Lauren Hefter!”
Reviews.Author: KathyK000
Reviews.Content: Laurelin Hefter (concierge) was fantastic. She worked very hard to accommodate the needs of myself and co-workers. The restaurants she recommended were perfect. She followed up a few days before my arrival to find out if she could arrange anything else for my trip. Great service Laurelin! Your staff is the reason I would recommend this hotel. My only complaint is the Wi-Fi should be in the room rate and not an extra fee.

Reviews.Title: “A Long-lost Friend”
Reviews.Author: ProfessoressaQ
Reviews.Content: In 2002, I became a frequent and avid patron of W Hotels - particularly due to their attention to service. Although the NYC W's received most of my business, I've stayed at W's around the world. However, I felt that with the W's increasing popularity over the years also brought an increasing lack of attention to detail (which they had become known for). Consequently, I began staying at other hotels and as of 2009, had given up on the W. Thankfully, the W Chicago - City Center brought me back! My stay at this property reminded me of all of the things I loved about the W - the modern hotel and room decor, the stylish atmosphere, the lush amenities, and the Whatever/Whenever approach to service. And yet, it wasn't one specific incident that made me feel welcomed. Instead, it was a consistent level of warmth and attentiveness that made my stay exceptional. After my stay at the W Chicago - City Center, I look forward o returning to the W Hotel properties. So I say "thanks" to this W for bringing me back to the fold.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller067
Reviews.Content: Went on a girls trip with my 18 year old niece to go shopping. We were amazed at how big the room was and the service was top notch, The conciege team was fantastic and were able to help with everything. I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice as expected, but some temperature problems in the room”
Reviews.Author: michdoll
Reviews.Content: My stay was ok and the room was much bigger and nicer than my previous stay. But one thing I have to point out is that the room was uncomfortably warm. I arrived early in the morning and as soon as I got in I turned the heat down to the lowest it would go (65 degrees) and when I returned later that night, it was still very warm. Getting showered and dressed the next morning was very uncomfortable as it still didn't cool off. I left for work feeling like I already needed another shower! One other small thing was that I brought a Netflix CD to watch and the instructions near the DVD player didn't match what was on the screen and I couldn't get it to work. That was disappointing. Other than that, I appreciated being accommodated for such an early check-in and the staff were very nice and friendly from the bellman to the front desk. There even was a free continental "business breakfast" that morning which was a nice start.

Reviews.Title: “Very Polite and Helpful Service”
Reviews.Author: 95Tribe
Reviews.Content: All employees encountered at the W Hoteal were very polite and helpful. Trip Advisor Laurelin was especially helpful and contacted me prior to and during my stay to offer help and information. Questions were answered promptly allowing me to plan my trip in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Dont sound ur money there, really not worth it trust me!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello, My thoughts on the W city center is basically that up to now it is the worst W hotel I've ever stayed at. Thank god we didn't spend much time in the room because really the more I was in there the worst I felt about having paid so much for that kind of quality. One comment would be to redo ur bathtubs! The room we stayed in #1222 had a shipped bath tub I really didn't feel food about showering in there. Another complaint is that there was no complimentary coffee in the room. This is the first time I go to a hotel and no coffee or tea is offered in the room. Then we went to the gym and half the machines were out of order and the rest of them were being used so we couldn't do our workout. Finally when we came back from shopping on saturday our room wasnt even made we had to call front desk to request to house keeper to come.Â So my complaints aren't about the staff they are more about the quality of the hotel. Knowing the W hotel reputation and having stayed at the W in Montreal and in new York I expected a certain level of quality but didn't get that at all... Im really disappointed but thank god for Chicago being such an extraordinary city cause we still enjoyed our week-end. Just couldn't wait to leave the hotel. We will definitely not risk it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great concierge staff.”
Reviews.Author: decassid
Reviews.Content: Laurelin Hefter and Vanessa Lopez are excellent concierge staff, and work very hard to accommodate your needs during your stay. The gym at this property is woefully inadequate, bur Laurelin and Vanessa were able to establish a relationship with a gym across the street to provide me with a negotiated day rate. This gym was *much* better. This property is good overall, but Laurelin and Vanessa are extremely responsive and attentive. I'll certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: tigre85
Reviews.Content: As usual, the W experience is exceptional in every way. However, during this stay Chicago with my father, the concierge supervisor, Landon, provided service beyond the norm. I ask a lot of questions, and he not only had knowledge of the city but also a great personality and helped me find what was best to do, whether for a great restaurant or museum or getting to any location. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: nikkigfoster
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have asked for a better hotel! I read a particular review on here that had me leary about staying, so I called the hotel and had other travel agents call to assure me that the review was untrue, and they were correct! I stayed for 4 nights on business and I kid you not, the stay was more spectacular each day. The customer service is 5star and everyone is so accomodating. The hotel food from IPO Restaurant is actually VERY GOOD!!!! The room was so comfortable and clean. Laurelin was fantastic as she tries to meet every request imaginable. The location was perfect to Michigan Ave, Magnificent Mile, and State St. shopping. My only suggestion is to request a courtyard view room if you want a quieter stay. I took that tip from a tripadvisor review and they were correct! I will surely return when I am back in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “An awsome time.”
Reviews.Author: jmcclear
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent! I must mention how much of a help Lauralin Hefter was at the Chicago City Center W Hotel, was to my trip and to my friends.
