She was wonderful and above and beyond helpful. The overall experience was great. The rooms were wonderful and well maintained. The staff as whole were excellent. I will definitely being staying at a W hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but what was going on in the lobby?”
Reviews.Author: Mikeywmikey31
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is excellent. Beautiful rooms with the normally overpriced amenities. The lobby area is trendy but it looks like the red light district down there. Something about women in there twenties hanging over men in there fifties just doesn't look right. Maybe I just don't know the city that well.

Reviews.Title: “W Chicago City Center is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenrogel
Reviews.Content: The W Chicago is a very nice hotel - good vibes, excellent amenities. I was contacted by Laurelin H, the "W Insider," prior to my arrival to ask if i had any special requests during my stay. I felt very welcome the moment I stepped into the hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: NYC York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Smiles, Smiles, Smiles.”
Reviews.Author: Miguad98
Reviews.Content: The one thing that stuck out during my stay there was how much everyone smiled there. All the staff were unbelievably helpful - Mike in the check in station got me walking directions, Laurelin printed and delivered some important papers, Venessa tried to get me some other papers, and when I couldn't send her the email, she offered to walk them to my meeting!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty but not comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Christie8255
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the W. We parked in a parking ramp across the street that was $35 for the night which is less than their $52/day valet. The hotel is very aesthetically pretty; the "Wonderful" room is white with splashes of color, very trendy and elegant. The lobby is very cool but dark and I was confused about where to check in at upon entry. The hotel was surprisingly not busy for a weekend which was nice. The first thing we noticed when we entered our room was that it was very warm and we had to shut the heat off. They gave us a room looking out to the furnace system on the ledge which was not pleasing. You could also hear the train going by every so often but it was only slight. The bed was much harder than I am use to at home so I could not sleep and basically woke up every hour all night. Even after turning the heat off it was still so hot that we ended up having to run the air/fan all night. Overall the hotel is beautiful looking but not comfortable for a good night sleep. It was a fun experience but not worth the hard earned money we spent for one night. There are definitely better options to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for business, very attentive staff, boutique feel...”
Reviews.Author: EricNYC10023
Reviews.Content: Pros: I travel to Chicago for business often, and this W is my regular home-away-from-home. The experience is a very personal one seldom, if ever, found in chain properties. That personal experience begins about a week prior to each of my stays: either Vanessa or Laurelin send me an email welcoming me back, and encouraging me to communicate any special requests (they've done everything from printing off client presentations to organizing romantic weekends when my girlfriend comes to town, all executed flawlessly). Upon arrival, Erica and Rosa, at reception, welcome me back and generously upgrade me to whichever best room is available (I travel frequently, suite upgrades make staying away from home much more palatable). From a dining perspective, the in-hotel "IPO" restaurant is a great improvement over the previous "WE." The dishes are much more inventive, and the chef is really good about accommodating special requests... Cons: The elevated train is close by and you will hear it unless you ask for a courtyard facing room. The hotel is in a business area, so there's not a lot going on in the neighborhood at night (that said, Little Italy, Greek Town, West Loop and River North are only a short cab ride away).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Milwaukee_Indian
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a night and stayed at the W. From the moment I walked in the service was amazing. After a long international flight it was just what I needed. Landon Moore was very helpful. I needed to do some shopping and Landon gave me some great tips on where to go and also the easiest way to get there. He was very knowledgeable, when I returned to the hotel he greeted me and asked about my shopping trip, the personal touch was well appreciated. The rooms at the W were wonderfully decorated and very modern. Overall a great stay. Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoy staying at the "W"”
Reviews.Author: rstgerma
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay while in Chicago at the annual Houseware's convention. Though I was given the smallest room in my long history of staying at the "W" properties I did enjoy the hospitality of the staff and in particular that of Laurelin Hefter. Over the course of my stay Laurelin arranged both dinner plans and an adequate gym for me and my co-worker to work out as I was not that satisfied with the gym that was provided. I will most definitely stay at the "W" again as the service is always impeccable and I always get a great nightâ€™s sleep. Sincerely, Raymond St.Germain Sincerely, Raymond St.Germain

Reviews.Title: “W City Center is the best!”
Reviews.Author: brianharrington
Reviews.Content: My W Insider, Laurelin Hefter, always makes sure that my stay is a success. I have made this W hotel my home away from home - in large part due to Laurelin and her associates. The people, location, food & lounge and wonderful rooms are all a 10!!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal hotel with great staff, especially the conceirge.”
Reviews.Author: dermagirl
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, I will never stay anywhere else while visiting Chicago. The customer service at this hotel is outstanding. The entire staff goes above and beyond to make sure all your needs are taken care of. Eden, the conceirge, is one of the kindest and most helpful people I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. Somehow she got us reservations for a party of 10 at Gibson's (a very popular restaurant) less than 24 hours before. We had been trying to get reservations at this restaurant for 2 weeks, and somehow Eden pulled it off at the last minute. We were here for business for over a week and she had made sure we had all our needs taken care of. The Acura car service is so convenient and offered at no charge. Great hotel! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: mist2myst
Reviews.Content: I travel for work and usually spend more nights on the road than at home. What I appreciate the most is not having to deal with issues with hotel bookings or services at the end of a long and stress workday. The staff at the W Citycenter has been great. Specifically, my W Insider, Laurelin, would reach out to me to make sure that everything I need would be anticipated and arranged before my arrival. I try not to ask for too much, but when I do, I know that Laurelin could do what she can to fulfill my request. Having this more personal connection is invaluable in helping me enjoy my stay and keeps me going back to the W Citycenter repeatedly.

Reviews.Title: “That's it - I'll never stay anywhere but a W Hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: shelauren
Reviews.Content: We were at the Palmer House but switched to the W after one night. Everything is impeccable and the wonderful surprises just keep coming. We stopped into the hotel restaurant, IPO, after a long day of choir rehearsals. My daughter was craving milk and cookies but settled on ice cream. Tonight we returned to our room to find cookies, plus a box of candy, granola bars, water, several small gifts and a note from Jamie telling my daughter best of luck at choir practice and "reach for the stars." Plus a free drink coupon for the W bar. This is just one example of the extreme service, luxury and pampering we have come to expect from every W Hotel. Love, love, love!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought”
Reviews.Author: dastony1969
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in only two other downtown hotels( The Swissotel & The Hyatt ) and they both blow this W away! The lobby is beautiful, and the staff was friendly & professional. Maybe because I had a 'King Superior" room and not a suite. The view was of other buildings and roofs and the bathroom was probably, originally a closet. The room was neat but it seemed as if the carpet was just thrown down. For the price( $261 ), I should have tried somewhere else. Just my opinion!

Reviews.Title: “My stay was a fantastic indulgence I am sure to repeat.”
Reviews.Author: pegasus19
Reviews.Content: I was facing an overwhelming workload in the office and knew I needed to put long hours in at the office. Laurelin Hefter recommended I spend a night at the hotel to eliminate my commute and to provide me with some relaxation. She was so right. I was able to put in a long day at work and then have an incredibly relaxing experience which helped me be refreshed and able to get a lot done the next day. I am sure I will indulge myself with a night at the W-Chicago City Center several times this year.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Service is Great....”
Reviews.Author: big_broncs
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 great days here at this hotel unwinding and I can say that the concierge service given by Laurelin was impeccable. She made sure we were lined up for the best restuarants, and lounges and made our stay memerobale... Cheers KT

Reviews.Title: “Poor Experience”
Reviews.Author: MLPTraveler
Reviews.Content: Bed Bugs...need I say more. I am still recovering from the bites. I was in this hotel for three nights. I noticed the first bite the morning of my second night and didn't think anything of it. On my final morning, I woke up to groups of bits on my left side and back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great concierge and desk staff, restaurant lacking”
Reviews.Author: djh1960
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with a great concierge, Laurelin Hefter, who is smart, unfailing pleasant, and extremely efficient. Check in was very nice with hot chocolate, chocolate covered pretzels and a platinum upgrade. We have a conference room, which was well arranged, stocked, and Laurelin made she everyone found it and could get internet. The restaurant menu is too "out there", I had the bucatini for lunch, a pasta dish that tasted like spaghetti with bacon bits (the fake ones not the real ones), service was tepid. Bar menu (only thing available on Sunday evening) was incredibly limited and service was tepid. I think the hotel would benefit from a menu-redo in both bar and restaurant, with a bit more to cater to the traveller. Moreover, the internet got spotty during the day Tuesday???? Can't say why??? Some great people work here, my room was very nice, but mixed bag due to lack of dining arrangements in the winter season when southern travelers don't want to go outside.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond the "hip" its kinda icky”
Reviews.Author: Evanston_Jeff
Reviews.Content: I used to think that a "W" was classy, chic and fun. The lobby here definately gives that impression with low-lighting and hip music....which is kinda "cool" on a Friday or Saturday evening, but seems a bit odd on Monday morning. The rooms have a new coat of paint, but the carpet is a bit shoddy and the rooms have a wierd set up. The hotel rooms try too hard to be edgy, but fail to impress after the first 30-seconds. The rooms are also small and bathrooms even smaller- the size of the rooms would be more typical in Europe than in the US> Overall....it was a disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Amazing Conceirge!”
Reviews.Author: Naeblis
Reviews.Content: So I often stay at W Hotels when traveling, but the W City Center in Chicago is really top notch. The hotel is classy chic with a really great vibe. Good gym, huge rooms fully equipped with a wonderful bath. One of the best night's sleep you can ever have. I'd also like to call attention to Laurelin, the concierge. I was meeting a friend that I hadn't seen in almost 25 years and was looking for a great place for dinner. Of course, I had my heart set on the Girl and the Goat, but there is no way to get into that place without 6 weeks notice. Well, not so for Laurelin! She made a quick call, spoke some secret magic, said go on over, and we walked in and were sat on the spot! The manager was expecting us and the other greeters were stunned by us getting the royal treatment! The W City Center is my place to stay in Chicago, period.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge knew her stuff!”
Reviews.Author: travelingjulia_10
Reviews.Content: I was suprise with a trip to Chicago this Valentine's Day from my husband and it was our first time to the city. In the midst of packing bags and booking suprise flights, I guess my husband forgot to plan ANYTHING we were to do on this trip lol. Well the staff and the W saved us from utter confusion! Upon arrival the front desk gave us a bus/train map and the concierge gave us a great place to eat. Two nights later Laurelin, one especially nice concierge recommended a cute greek place for desserts and the bell staff ordered us a taxi. My past experiences with W hotels have honestly been filled with stuck up staff and snooty attitudes, but this trip makes up for it all. Everyone from roomservice to bellhops made us feel special. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel City Center Review”
Reviews.Author: Ariel0708
Reviews.Content: Hi! I recently stayed at the W City Center hotel in Chicago Illinois for one night for my boyfriend birthday. I have to say this is a really funky hotel to say the least, everything is very modernized which makes for a very different/unique stay. Costumer Service: The costumer service here was fantastic, they pretty much did everything you ask for as soon as you ask for it. Also they have a whenever wherever policy which pretty much provides you with any service whenever and wherever. My boyfriend and I got a couples massage in our rooms and it was fantastic. Food: The food is a bit pricey but very good. We ordered room service and it got there within a 1/2 hour Beds: The beds were amazing Sleep: I thought the room was very quiet and I slep extremely well for those reviews that say you could hear the L get over it, it really wasn't bad Room: The rooms are very small be prepared for an intimate stay Bathrooms: Awesome shower heads and vanity a great place to get ready for a night out or wedding All in all great stay for those of you who are looking for a modern/classy experience this is the place for you. : )

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable experience.”
Reviews.Author: TWCali
Reviews.Content: Everyone was extremely helpful. Laurelin Hefter, at guest services, recommended an amazing restaurant (The Custom House) and even got an earlier reservation at our convenience. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Services”
Reviews.Author: ncaadam
Reviews.Content: My room service late night food was quick, simple, and good. Also when I needed to print a document out, instead of making me use the business services that I would of had to pay for, the concierge offered to print it for me. Laurelin Hefter helped me very much in that aspect because I was in a hurry. She was very helpful, personable, and hospitable. The stay has been beyond stupendous.

Reviews.Title: “W concierge service is outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Gatorius
Reviews.Content: The W is wonderful, but our stay wouldn't have been nearly as memorable without the assistance of the outstanding concierge staff. Laurelin managed to get us dinner reservations which would have been impossible without her contacts, and she got us head-of-the-line passes to a few of Chicago's best nightclubs. Eden was able to get us theater tickets (5th row center) to a sold-out production. The Acura experience was also a convenient touch, and our driver Rick was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay despite what others say”
Reviews.Author: fritzrobertson
Reviews.Content: First of all, we did get a great rate, 109 per night. My daughter set up the W as the designated hotel for guests coming to Chicago for her wedding. Initial calls to get our reservation were not well handled; some of the staff I talked to at that time had no clue. I called in December to make our reservation for the group rate and was told by one guy, "But sir, you are asking me to look up a group rate for next year!" That was kind of amusing, since I was asking about dates less than two months away, and the block had already been set up, so I was a bit leery about the level of IQ of staff when I headed up to Chicago to stay at the W. But we were pleasantly surprised. Once we got there, pretty much everyone was helpful, smart, and cool. The Acura experience deal is quite nice; used it to get my tux and to get to the wedding venue and got to ride in a nice vehicle. No high pressure sale, just a little info about Acuras. The concierges were both very nice and helpful--got the name of one of them, Edan Bernal. Gave us directions to great places in walking distance for breakfast and lunch: Lou Mitchell's and the Miller Pub. The W is very conveniently located, and yes, it is right next to the L, but if you actually have trouble sleeping because an L train is going by, you probably didn't have enough drinks at the bar. They do have a nice bar and lounge area at the W. It's expensive, but that's expected when you're at a nice hotel. Bar staff could cheer up and be more personable: one of three servers appeared to enjoy life; the other two seemed to think having a fairly nice job is a burden and that it is hip to be sour and indifferent to customers. I could complain about some of the loud, rich, young, rude people who hung out at the bar one night; but I've learned to ignore such imbeciles and just enjoy a good drink, which the bar does serve. We got upgraded to a nicer room (I think they call it the Spectacular room; the place is pretentious as all get out: on one of the drink coasters in the room they had this written: "What are you thinking right now? Write it down." I told my wife I was going to write something insulting, but she said I needed to settle down, so I did.) They also have an obnoxious saying which you see at all times in the room: Stop trying to find yourself and create yourself instead. That's not exact but that's the gist of it. Profound, I thought. Oh well, the room is still really comfortable, has a great tv, a damn nice bathroom, and the usual overpriced crap in the mini-bar. Still nice to have an option to have a drink in the room if you want one. Beds are very nice and comfortable. One day they didn't clean our room but when I asked the next day, it was done promptly. Really was no big deal. Then when we were checking out, and it was much more convenient to check out a little later, they had absolutely no problem with giving us a later checkout and didn't hassle us at all. That was cool. Lots of places are royal pains when you ask for late checkout. I realize this review may appear less complimentary than my overall rating indicated, but I really did enjoy staying there. It's kind of foolish to let little imperfections outweigh an overall fine experience, and the stay was actually quite nice for both my wife and me.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the W Chicago City Center-great service!”
Reviews.Author: sue32066
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Chicago City Center for 12 days on business. Laurelin Hefter, Landon and Greg in the Concierge department were all so helpful and kind! They helped me with some business issues as well as gave me great recommendations for restaurants including a fun place to watch the Bears-Packers game. Emmiko was there every morning and afternoon manning the restaurant and always had a big hello for me. She was very personable and professional. Regina took care of my room and always had a smile on her face and a great attitude. When you are on business for 12 days, it certainly helps when you have friendly,professional people who are always there to help and greet you with a smile. Great customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff - The W Insider is Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: tm_tokyo
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend checking out this hotel when you're visiting Chicago! It is newly remodeled and has some of the nicest rooms in the city, but really what sets this hotel apart is the excellent staff who are some of the best in the Starwood family. If you need assistance be sure to contact the W Insiders. Ms. Hefter went out of her way to help me prepare for an important meeting and is truly one of a kind! I look forward to staying at the W City Center the next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for Wicked”
Reviews.Author: okunba
Reviews.Content: Honestly...I must say I'm speechless about this place. I felt like I was treated like a King sitting on his throne while employees like Laurelin Hefter serve crazy amounts of service to you. My bedroom was great! The W has found its niche! Great employees, great atmosphere, classy, and when you want service to kiss your feet...this is the place...you don't even have to ask........thanks for such a great experience W...and Laurelin!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Luna4204
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Chicago in November, our first trip away from our new baby, and we couldn't have been happier with our stay at the W. The concierge, Laurelin, was absolutely wonderful, going out of her way to make our stay fun and comfortable. She recommended a fantastic restaurant for dinner and a great place for breakfast the next day. All around great trip.

Reviews.Title: “two Thursday in a row”
Reviews.Author: fvrbtmn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at W Chicago - City Center on January 13th and 20th and enjoyed both experience very much. The first time, I arrived late and ordered room service - both the "Pappardelle" and the "Hanger Steak" were wonderful. This time, I traveled with my colleague and we dined at the hotel restaurant, IPO. Our waiter, Alfredo, was very helpful and all his recommendations were delicious. We started with the mini osso buccoand Tempura Shrimp. I enjoyed both appertizers, especially the rock shrimp ravioli that came with the Tempura Shrimp. I had the Mushroom-crusted Tuna - PERFECT!!! You have to try this. The staff were exceptional and the hotel is defintiely CHIC!! On the day I checked out, I did not receive my WSJ and NYTimes and mentioned to the concierge. Shortly after, he called and bought both newspaper to my door. Last but not least, all the reception/checkin staff were so warm, friendly and cheerful. The only thing I would ask next time is to have a room facing LaSalle, away from the L train. Arthur Starwood Member

Reviews.Title: “Would def book the W again, amazing time in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mandimichele
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 rooms at the Chicago City Centre Hotel, for New Years Eve and 3 nights after, rooms were immaculate/trendy/posh, service was impeccable...hotel is beautiful thru and thu. Def would recommend and will def stay here again! They stock the rooms with great Bliss products, was a nice touch, the concierge service is on point and ready to help with any needs, even sending runners down to the 7 eleven to get pepto for hungover guests! When we arrived at the hotel one of the rooms was less than desirable and was a corner stay, after a brief conversation with the welcome desk they quickly accommodated and changed the room location to an extremely fabulous room. Great location, $5 cab ride really to so many bars and nightspots...cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, as long as you can get a room away from the L.”
Reviews.Author: Travelsuperfreak
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while visiting my boyfriend, who was in Chicago on business. While the location isn't superb, it is very close to the L, which means you can get wherever you want to go very easily. However, being so close to the L also means that many of the rooms are not that great for sleeping! We were upgraded to a deluxe room, but it was so noisy that we chose to move back to a standard room. The rooms vary in size quite a bit. Since my boyfriend was here over the course of several weeks, he ended up experiencing this personally. On one stay, he had a very nice-sized standard room, but when I was there, the standard room we switched to when we were downgraded was a corner one, and while it was nice to have two large windows, it was TINY. The fitness center was adequate, clean, and had new-ish equipment. The lobby is very nice, in a nightclubby sort of way, and yes, the first time I arrived, I had to ask for directions to the check-in desk. We booked with an AAA rate which included breakfast for 2 each morning, and the breakfasts were great! All in all, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This 'W' ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: ashevilleluva
Reviews.Content: Ok people...it is by the "L", it's downtown Chicago, get over it. It's an absolutely stunningly chic property. Yes, the rooms are a bit tight but they are beautiful. We loved being so close to the "L" because it allowed us to explore the City with relative ease. One night we ended up partying it up in the lobby because the drinks and service was so good. We also used the complimentary "Acura Experience" shuttle to take us to the Magnificent Mile. Loved it. If you are looking for a sleek, trendy, forward place to stay, stay here! If not, stay at the "W - Lakeshore".

Reviews.Title: “Not Football fan or family appropriate”
Reviews.Author: muskyhunter54
Reviews.Content: I was very dissapointed with this hotel despite the attractive room rate. It is truly an ala carte experience. Wi fi $15, Business center $7 for 15 minutes, printer $0.69 for B&W page. But the crowning blow is putting chic above your customer requests. Here's an example . There were about 12 people in the bar on Monday night. The Bears were playing the Vikings. They have 3 large HD TVs behind the bar. When the game started I asked the bartender if she could turn down the incessant techo music they were playing and turn on the TV sound so we could hear the game. Her response when she asked the manager was No. The music is part of their branding. Can you believe that ? All but 2 people in the bar were watching the game. I am glad as a Packer fan that this would never happen in a hotel in Wisconsin! One last note keep the kids out of the mini bar. It might take you a while to explain the $10 Intimacy Kit ( condoms and lubricants) to the little ones.

Reviews.Title: “Right next to the "L"”
Reviews.Author: kne511
Reviews.Content: Typical W hotel but location was not ideal. My room was right next to the "L" so it kept me up all night.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT go back - Couldnt wait to check out”
Reviews.Author: TravelnLite
Reviews.Content: Yeah, ok, trendy and chic and good service - BUT to agree with some reviewers I was shocked at the size of the rooms. The bathroom is the smallest I have ever seen in a US hotel. I had to climb around the sink to reach the bath/shower faucet. The decor in the room was clearly designed for VERY young guests.. by that I mean it feels like a college dorm. The motivational signs, runway lighting, horrible puke-cream color walls... everything was very very disappointing. The thermostat was also set to not go below 65 degrees, although it felt more like 80 degrees in the room. One of the worst hotel stays I can remember - even the check-in experience is TOO much. The concept of being in a nightclub goes all the way through the lobby to the reception area and into the elevators (with holograms an all). The only thing I looked forward to in this hotel was CHECKING OUT. If you are19 or 20 years old you might enjoy this hotel - but I do NOT recommend this for business or family travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, trendy and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hockeytraveller-2010
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at the W, staff was amazing from the valet all the way to the room staff. The decor is great, room was larger than expected, it's the small details that make the stay an experience. Make sure to have a drink in the lobby/lounge area. Great location easily accessed the city and train system. Ipod dock was a huge hit. Will surely return. A+++

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business stay but right next to the L”
Reviews.Author: DrJTN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Chicago for 4 nights last week while attending a large convention at McCormick Place. I stay at other W Hotels frequently, mainly in Atlanta and New York. This W is similar to most - trendy, loud music, young clientele, expensive drinks. I was upgraded to a "fabulous" room (1917) and the room was good size with an ample work desk, king size bed, and reasonably large bathroom. Bathroom lighting was good, but the shower was pretty average for a W (standard tub and shower head). I get spoiled with the large walk-in rain showers at the Atlanta W Midtown. The bed was very comfortable and I was mostly able to sleep well thanks to playing the iPod stereo while falling asleep. As other reviewers have commented, the L was right below my room and runs every few minutes late into the night and early in the morning. My room didn't shake but it was indeed loud enough to awaken me in the morning. I am a pretty heavy sleeper so this didn't bother me too much, but if you are a light sleeper I would consider a different hotel. I ate room service breakfast and it was delivered right on time and was very good, though expensive (bowl of oatmeal, berries, and OJ = $24). Lunch in the restaurant was also very good. Drinks at the bar are pricey but typical for an upscale hotel in the city. Housekeeping did a nice job making up the room and the rest of the service staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel is about 5 blocks from the Art Institute and there are several good restaurants within walking distance and a good pub 2 blocks away. The famous Berghoff Restaurant in 3 blocks away and a good place for lunch. There is not much in the way of evening entertainment that I found near the hotel. Whereas many W Hotels tend to be a gathering place and attract a good party crowd, that is not the case here. Except for the lobby music, this W is pretty quiet in the evenings. Overall, this was a decent place to stay and I might stay here again if I had business directly in the loop. The L is pretty noisy but the rooms were comfortable, clean and the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “These are some small trendy rooms- make-up on an older hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kitalexi
Reviews.Content: The W is a cool chain. City center fits the W bill, but a few things go awry. The remodel kept the old shower/bathtub configuration. This is not the easiest tub/shower to get in and out of. The new (er) W's have chic showers- these aren't. The rooms are small and there isn't enough light. It's just dark. A compact property that would be OK for a single traveler. The staff was excellent- well trained and very ready to serve. This W just isn't worth the extra $$ however.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel For Work, Not Play”
Reviews.Author: NoahKAllen
Reviews.Content: Overall, the W City Center meets, but does not exceed expectations. I stayed there for 5 nights and didn't have one issue with the service or amenities. That being said, if you were in Chicago on pleasure, you might want to go elsewhere. First off, the location isn't fantastic, as it's in the heart of downtown and the surrounding area is dead. Additionally, the lobby bar doesn't provide much of a diversion (although the decor is awesome). If you're looking to go out, you should check in with one of the concierges. The ones on staff when I was there had a pretty sound knowledge of nightlife. Although, make sure you're specific about what you're looking for. During my stay I had one arrange bottle service at club no too far from the hotel, and it ended up sucking pretty terribly. I blame this more on myself though, as clubs in Chicago suck in general and I shouldn't have asked about going to one. The bar scene in Chicago is awesome and the clubs tend to attract "clubby" people - you know, the crew cut and slacks crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Turn off the music and turn on the lights”
Reviews.Author: judyNorthEast
Reviews.Content: Scented candles, dimmed lights, moving objects and screens everywhere you go, including the elevator. Hoped the room will be a refuge - but alas, we got a room on the 4th floor, with windows that open to the AC and heating equipments and all of that for $550 per night. When we asked nicely to leave the next day, we were allowed to with no penalty fee. The staff is very nice and accommodating but the facility is unacceptable for such a price

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonaVSeattle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights for a business trip. My office is only 3 blocks away so it was convenient for work. It was in a good neighborhood but I had to walk several blocks to get to Michigan Ave. (next time I think cabbing is better) The hotel is very beautiful, modern and clean. It's got some good restaurants and bars near by. It is pricey but what do you expect with a W? I had a great night sleep and workout facilities were decent.

Reviews.Title: “very nice, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: amamomma07
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. Was there for a business conference in the hotel. Beautiful architecture - great contrast of traditional, old world design with the very modern furniture and decor. Nice staff, although didn't interact with them much. Bedroom is quite small but beautiful and plenty of space for 1 and a little tight with kids. I was in a one queen-bed room. Great location for walking to shops and restaurants. Best part are the Bliss products. :) Can't comment on price though, because the company paid for it and I don't know how much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good service”
Reviews.Author: jeffreyt2000
Reviews.Content: Disclosure statement - I am Starwood Platinum. We stayed here for 1 night on the way to Michigan. We had 2 rooms reserved - a "wonderful" room and a "Spectacular" room. They upgraded the wonderful to spectacular and gave us a free bottle of water per day. Since we were taking the 5:30 train, we also were given late checkout. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable and the doormen and bell hops were fun to talk to and joke around with. In the W tradition they shoot for trendy and cool with dark lobby areas, funky furniture and lighting, and cool music. While there are a few misses, most of it works. The rooms were spacious and the beds were of course wonderful. Service was good, and we took advantage of the Acura car service for getting to dinner and to the train station. The only complaint I have is that the whole front desk and concierge area is rather small so it was a little crowded and with only 1 concierge on duty there was usually a line. The location may not be the best for nightlife and other activities, but it is convenient for the train station and the Millennium Park / Art Institute area - both a reasonable walk away.

Reviews.Title: “no phone or no sleep”
Reviews.Author: tvterror
Reviews.Content: i am a platinum starwood and usually get upgraded. in this case i didn't, but that was ok. rooms were nice and clean. housekeeping was good and everything worked well. big issue: initially got an inside room for some reason which looks on the interior courtyard. could not get a signal on my iphone and when i did, kept getting disconnected. complained to front desk and they moved me the following night to an outside room. still no upgrade...but that is ok. then i realized why the inside room is actually better. the L train is right below the hotel and zooms by till 1 AM and then starts at 5 AM every 20 min. Could not sleep and the room rattles. Location of the hotel is not near anything fun too. Need to take a cab pretty much everywhere. Next time stay at the westin north shore. I've learned my lesson for trying to be cool.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & great facilities, just average rooms.”
Reviews.Author: dre_techie
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights at the W Chicago City Center, and I'll say that my overall experience was great. There was a trade show in town, so the hotel bar was pretty busy. The W brand is nicely defined in the public areas. The rooms I was disappointed by. I had a Wonderful room, but I was surprised by the traditional hotel room layout, pretty small and quite subdued in style. The bathroom was completely separated and there is no walk-in shower (like every other W I've stayed at), just a bathtub. You could clearly tell that the hotel was converted from a more traditional hotel. If you're not booking this hotel mainly to be blown away by the W style, then I'd recommend it, otherwise book a larger room/suite.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tarky1968
Reviews.Content: Despite the hotel being described as the W 'City Center' dont be fooled, its miles from where you would want to stay in Chicago and away from all of the other major hotels in the City. The W is located a fair way away from anything of interest, its neighbourhood is what you would rate as secondary nothing like the area of the other '4-5 stars' in and around the magnificient mile. Then there are the rooms...not only are they tiny but W has tried to hide the quality of their furnitures with gadgets/gizmos/magazines/signs that arent really much use to anyone, the noise from the corridors etc. is untrue they really need to soundproof. I also found that the staff were less that friendly, the concierge was constantly on the phone and made you aware in no uncertain terms that he had better things to do than to help your stay so much for their 'whatever-whenever' service. Folks if you are going to Chicago it really would be worth your while to pay a few extra $'s and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED the W ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: mikeyam
Reviews.Content: I travel quite often for work and have stayed in just about every hotel possible except the W. I had a rare occasion of being in state for another round of business and rather then drive the 40 miles home that night I decided to give the hotel a whirl. I was referred by a friend to their "whatever/whenever" service. I called and was greeted by a lady named Nicole Norton. I was able to feel her smile radiate through the phone and already knew I made a good choice. When I expressed to her my accommodation needs for the night she guaranteed me that they would be handled even though it was short notice. I was even more shocked when I had walked into my suite and saw how gorgeous it was. Being a fan of modern and trendy decor, this made me feel right at home. In the office area then was a nice tray of fruits and cheeses with a personal hand written note saying that if I needed anything she was just a call away. I thought I was in complete awe until my phone rang and it was her. She called just to say she saw I checked in and asked if the room was to my liking and again ensured me that whatever I needed was a call away. In the 8+ years Iâ€™ve been travelling for work, never ever one time have I had someone as attentive and outgoing......I am even happier that I found this gem so close to home!!! I will without a doubt, 100% be visiting The W again and will be sure to take that extra step to see if another W property is within my travel area. All the other people who say itâ€™s expensive, its "to trendy", etc obviously has no idea the value of what it is. ....... Stay at the Trump one night where you will pay double and get Super 8 Motel service. Props to you Ms. Norton, because of you, The W has gained another lifelong client!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, great room, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: NikoPseudo
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in July, on a Sunday night, when there was no one downtime and very little noise. The room was designed superbly, with all sorts of quirky, imaginative, friendly details. I slept like a king, trained, had access to Millennium Park, the Museum District and the Sears Tower after a short stroll. Excellent location. I strongly recommend this hotel, my favourite in Chicago so far.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but OK Rooms”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Visitor
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now, mainly because of its excellent location in the financial district. The rooms are small, but clean. Be sure to ask for a room away from the El trains, otherwise you will be kept awake from the trains rumbling past. I think this this a fine hotel, but the room rate seems inexplicably high.

Reviews.Title: “Brusque staff ruined a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeffFlorida
Reviews.Content: Bar staff and management disinterested and condescending. Little follow up by Hotel Manager- too little too late. Conciergemust have to personally apy for Newspapers- very stingy. Rooms were very nice and well appointed. Daily service missed altogether one day. Nice gym area. Very close to CTA.

Reviews.Title: “Extreme WOW at the W Chicago City Center”
Reviews.Author: RobbieB737
Reviews.Content: Back at the W again for 3 nights. I stay at Ws around the world as well as some other hotel chains but always always look forward to be being back at the W city center in Chicago. I got in Wednesday night and the service all the way from the door man to check -in and then the room itself are all emaculate. Slept like a baby..worked out at 7 and unlike many hotels the gym is big enough where it doesn't seem crowded even though there er equite a few people.. Alright..now to my favorite part..my girl Eden is on point all the time. I had called her yesterday before I got in from DC..she caled me back and asked me how many nights I was going to be in and what I wa slooking to do. That's all..I walk in this evening to my hotel and my next 2 nights are all planned out..dinner reservations..hottest club vip list..all the newest hotspots..and here the cherry..she even arranged for the complimentary Acura that all Ws provide to take my party to all the spots. I am a snob.I practiclaly live out of hotels, therefore expect the best. You can't do any better than this! Find out for yourself if you don't believe me. Please call on Eden..she ROCKS!!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: mjaaustin
Reviews.Content: Both W Chicago hotels are nothing but the best. The service is impeccable. Upon checking into the W City Center, the front desk clerk noticed it was the day before my birthday. I checked into my room and then left for dinner. Upon returning, they had sent an amazing Chocolate Birthday cake and fresh fruit to my room compliments of the hotel. What class! It's the little things that make W Hotels so great. Same goes for the W Lakeshore. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Concierge TLC”
Reviews.Author: travelredcard
Reviews.Content: I have great things to say about the Concierge desk. We exchanged wonderfully informative emails before my trip. I got deliciously perfect sushi recommendations while there. They knew my name (even across shift--changes at the desk) and were helpful and friendly at every turn - even assisting us with a Cubs ticket upgrade. We were put into a non-traditional room designed for handicap accessibility, when we questioned if there was another room with a tub, there was not, but we got cookies and juice sent to our room. They took care of us and the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny dark rooms comes with dose of obnoxious service”
Reviews.Author: EWSPS95
Reviews.Content: What a disappointing weekend stay at the W City Center! The rooms are tiny - we were told that "most of our rooms are that size" and extremely dark. The bathroom was so tight that no more than 1 person could be inside at a time. The hallways in the guest room floors are narrow and institutional. The lobby is so loud filled with non guests. The reception desk is tiny with no counter space. To further the assault, the front desk service by one individual in particular was rude and with attitude. I have stayed at many W Hotels and Starwood properties and this was the absolute worst. While it may be true that the W line is for certain tastes, this one made all the little perks that typically make the stay more enjoyable, seem gimmicky. Stay elsewhere at one of the many other options in Chicago if possible!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service! Highly recommend the concierge staff..”
Reviews.Author: Ladytrainer
Reviews.Content: Stayed in WChicago -City Center over the 4th of July weekend. The interior of the hotel is a little on the dark side as you enter but it's location to all of the major attractions is great. Rooms were on the small side with no drawers; you had to put your stuff in a hanging bag but the service was wonderful. Any time we ordered anything - towels, coffeemaker it was there immediately. The restaurant attached to the hotel was very nice. Wish I could remember the waiter's name (I think it was James) the first night we were there - had dinner before seeing a show and he was terrific. Brought us out glasses of champagne and a complimentary dessert. Also of mention were the concierge staff. Vanessa took our original reservations for several tours; Landon helped us out while we were there and Laurelin was so sweet; getting me tickets at the last moment to Blue Man Group - her smile lit up the place. Also Albert Jones at the Front desk - great customer service and Heather was very nice as well. We also used the Whenever, Whatever Acura car service which took us everywhere. As someone who works in a hotel on the East Coast I can't say enough about how attentive the service was at all times - nothing seemed to be a problem. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Partylitefun
Reviews.Content: Our Welcome Desk Agent, Richard Boven, was especially helpful, friendly and positive. Our experience was a delight because of all of the staff at the W. We'll come back again, and we'll tell all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great W; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EWRFlyerAL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many W hotels around the country and this one is great. Some other reviewers have complained about the hip decor or that it is too dark and clubby. If that's not your scene, I suggest you look elsewhere. If you're into minimalist design, well-appointed rooms, and a staff that looks "cool and aloof" is actually very friendly and accommodating then the W is for you. I am a Platinum with SPG and received an upgrade from a Wonderful Room to a Fabulous Room. The room was spacious, had a great bed, and a very nice bathroom. W prides itself on "Whatever, Whenever" and they met this expectation. We were in Chicago for my birthday and the hotel sent up a nice card and a voucher for breakfast for 2. An excellent touch. I will be staying at this hotel again this month and look forward to returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Large room excellent for 3 nights!”
Reviews.Author: idotter91
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to Chicago for a long weekend and we previously booked a Marriott property. The week before departure, I was checking rates and noticed the Marriott was more expensive than the W. I quickly cancelled my reservation and booked the W. I was extremely surprised by the property. Our room was spacious and we could not hear any city noise on the 21st floor. The bed and pillows were plush. The hotel is close to the loop and we road the train back to the airport which was cheap ($5 for the 2 of us). We took a cap from the airport upon arrival and paid about $40. The drink prices are spendy at the lobby bar, however it is Chicago. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I had high hopes...”
Reviews.Author: Ltathom
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a W and will probably be my last. I've always heard how great they are, but now I think the reality is that they appeal to a certain type of traveler. This hotel is conveniently located on the Orange "L" line and was a straight shot from Midway Airport. Also it was very easy to navigate Chicago and all the sights from here. Fortunately I did not spend that much time in the hotel; I just slept there. When I walked through the doors into the hotel everything went dark and there was loud music playing, as if I was in a nightclub or bar. Directly in my path were several sofas and various types of seating, with people all around. I could not see a check in area anywhere (it was off to the side in a corner with no directional markings). Once I did find the check in area there was a long line waiting for two men standing behind podiums with spotlights on them. Despite the fact that there were many "workers' milling around and seated at other desks in the lobby, these two were the only ones checking in guests. My room was small and I expected that. I did not expect to be without some place to hang my clothes, however, so I just hung them on the shower rod. The walls of the room were also thin. I could hear the televisions and conversations of my neighbors quite clearly. Otherwise I have no complaints about the room; it was basic and everything was clean and in working order. If you want a trendy/hip hotel with atmosphere in the lobby area then you will like this place. If you want rooms with a bit more space (and a closet), more lighting (even the elevators were dark) and a more traditional feel, then you can probably find that nearby.

Reviews.Title: “HANDS DOWN THE BEST EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD ...”
Reviews.Author: PerformanceAthletix
Reviews.Content: Fabulous! I could go on and on, a little tear rolled down my cheek when i had to leave. The way your staff answer the phones, the decor, the soap, the TUB, i took three baths in one day! The room service was divine, the whitefish sandwich tasted like something you could only get in Boston, New York or Miami. Sleeping in the bed was an experience to remember also. I was plus one for the Clear VIP party with Kanye and T-Pain Saturday night @ Le passage and I stayed in, i didn't want to leave my room under any circumstance and consequently missed one of the biggest parties of the year in Chicago. I never want to stay in another hotel anywhere else as long as I live. Every time I visit Chicago i feel obligated to stay at the W, i don't know if i could ever forgive myself if i didn't. Your team deserves and award, and you do too!

Reviews.Title: “Normally a huge fan of W but slightly disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: pepebrie
Reviews.Content: My husband often travels to Chicago for work. He has favorite restaurants and hotels but usually stays at the Trump. We are Starwood members so decided to try out the W for my first visit as I as tagging along for the weekend. We arrived at the W to a tiny room but usually size doesn't bother us if the service is excellent and the bed is comfy. This room was clean and minimalist. The common areas and the lobby were fantastic and the location is certainly good for touristy stuff. The Sears tower is across the street, Michigan Avenue is not a far walk and our favorite restaurants were a quick cab ride away. We spent our wedding night at a W in Manhattan (Union Square) and had a fantastic time. We weren't even paying for our room on the wedding night and were treated like royalty. Overall the Chicago CIty Center W seems to not have a clue about service. The front desk told us we could use pts for the weekend nights but upon checkout changed their mind. I ordered yogurt and coffee from room service on Saturday. After 1.5 hours they called to apologize for the delay. I was nice but assumed that since yogurt didn't need to be cooked they would send it up immediately. Another 30 mins went by so I called to cancel as we did not plan spending Saturday in our tiny hotel room. I got in the shower and as I was standing in a towel Room Service arrived with the "cancelled" order 2.5 hours after the order was placed. It was 2.5 hrs. late and they still wanted to charge us $38 for yogurt and coffee. The food was eventually comped but it seemed awfully over complicated for such a simple order. Sunday morning my husband went down to the lobby to obtain 2 cups of the W complimentary coffee that they offer at their lobby until 10:00 a.m. There were no cups so my husband asked a man behind the bar to find some as the complimentary coffee was ending soon. After waiting 10 minutes and asking 2 different people for cups, the original man returned and started cleaning up and dumping the coffee. My husband reminded him of his request for cups and but was shunned. He eventually went back and got cups but not without attitude. By the way there is no wireless and the connection is $30/day for their network. This was annoying. Overall the service was lacking for a W property. We had a decent stay but my expectations were higher and friends who were at other hotels near by for much less money had a better experience. The pros are the location, lobby bartenders, and the gym. Other than that I would not go back to this W location. Perhaps I'll do some reading about the other W property on N. Lakeshore Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: milena229
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience with Chicago (hands down my fav city!). The hotel is in a great spot. The lobby is uber trendy and chic. The room was tiny and dark. My view was of another room and it looked quite dingy.

Reviews.Title: “Posh hotel with all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: kirchnercrew
Reviews.Content: We had a great visit to the W Hotel on Adams street. The rooms were large and well appointed and the bed was so comfy! They offered Bliss toiletries which was a nice change from typical hotel shampoo. And to top it off, the staff was friendly and accomodating. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely pillows but noisy lobby!”
Reviews.Author: LondonSarah1234
Reviews.Content: This is one of those hotels where you feel disorientated when you go in. Why do they do that?! We arrived from London feeling jet-lagged so to go into a dimly lit lobby with loud music, where we had to wheel our suitcases past the feet of those lounging on white leather sofas, wondering where the reception desk was, was not a great start. The room was fine - lovely pillows, good desk space, though not much space to spread out your stuff on in the bathroom. I think this is more about style than substance, so if you like the feel of a nightclub, go ahead, but I prefer the quiet life. The tripadvisor ratings make it apparent that views of this hotel diverge greatly. Oh, and my colleague said his room smelled of tobacco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: barbi_10
Reviews.Content: The trip was a pleasure from the beginning. I arrived to the hotel before check in and was accomodated by Rosa at the front desk. Eden, the concierge was so kind and knew exactly where to send my sister and myself for a great night on the town and a great breakfast the next morning. The great service from the front desk to the concierge made for an enjoyable and pleasurable tavel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Overstimulating”
Reviews.Author: rgberg
Reviews.Content: Staff was nice, the bed was comfortable, the room was fine. The room was cozy. Great bathroom. The problem for me is that the hotel seems to be trying just a bit too hard to evoke a high-energy and cool vibe, which to me was simply irritating. If you like continuous loud music, garish lobby decor, dizzying 3D imagery (and loud music) in the elevators, then this place is for you. Also, internet in the room is not free, though it is free in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Super Conceirge Laurelin”
Reviews.Author: East_Village_Apts
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in Chicago. We were visiting our son at NorthWestern and wanted to take him and his friends out for dinner in Evanston. The check in was smooth, and I requested to see both room options. We were assigned a cute insider(that's the title-don't ask me why) who accompanied us to see the 5th floor suite-very dark. We opted for the spectacular room on the 20th floor which was much brighter. Modern, spacious, but very monochromatic in black, white and beige. Laurelin, the insider chatted with us and gave us recommendations for dinner with college kids-right on the ball, and lunch and brunch the following day with our son. She made our dining out experience in Chicago perfect. The hotel's location is in the financial district, so its a walk to the lake, mag mile, and a cab ride to the museums. It tries to be hip and trendy, and succeeds for the most part, but I think the "What is your wish" whenever you speak to an employee, is a bit over the top. One peeve-at check in they told me internet was not included in the room rate. I went to my room and called SP member hotline, where I had booked, and they told me it was. So, I called back the front desk and the staff confirmed it was, so I signed on for the 3 day package. They told me it would be removed from my bill at check in. When we saw that we had been charged $40 for the internet, I called the front desk and they refused to believe my statement about the call back and conversation with the employee. So, I left with a bitter taste, despite the amazing helpfulness of Laurelin. They go through all this effort to provide great customer service and then the from desk staff blows it away at checkout!!

Reviews.Title: “Why Stay Anywhere Else?”
Reviews.Author: richthecrook
Reviews.Content: ...loved our experience in Chicago. We are a west coast based clothing company and were on an east coast/ midwest tour. We had been to Ny, Boston, DC and our final stop was Chicago. We only stay in nice hotels. We like to think we have better taste level. In Boston we stayed at the liberty Inn..in Ny The Thompson, in DC, a Thompson sister hotel..all very nice and fancy...none compared to the W. Most spacious. Best design. best elevator...great staff...they were so helpful...Acura was providing transportation locally, within 5 miles, if you were a guest, and the hotel staff was so helpful in setting that up for us whenever we needed it. Laurelin was amazing on our last day. Helping us with bags and vehicle arrangements since we had a lot of baggage. Loved the W. We wont be staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Robbie does Chicago: Fabulous Hotel and even more Fabulous People”
Reviews.Author: RobbieB737
Reviews.Content: I am sorry folks, but I am guilty of never posting any reviews but selfishly checking out everything others post. However, my continued stellar experience at the W has finally compelled me to break the above habit. I have stayed at this hotel quite a few times when in Chicago and now living in chicago for a few weeks. The hotel is spectacular and that should go a long way coming from someone who practically lives out of hotels year round (342 stays last year). My biggest deal breaker is bad service and what really puts the hotel over the top for me is the service and the people. Eden and Laurelin, my concierge ladies have Chicago on complete lockdown. Its like they know what I would like better than I do and oh by the way, there has never been one time when I have needed dinner reservations or tables/bottle service or just getting into a club/lounge with a large party and they were not be able to come through. You can't go wrong with a W..but the people and service here is what makes it one of the best experiences in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: obom
Reviews.Content: I felt home that there was a Brasilian at check in; great service and she help us around. Hotel is beautiful and cool!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel with good service, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: spectra21
Reviews.Content: This is a really hotel with a swanky, modern decor, but the rooms are tiny. No complaints about the quality of bed and room furnishings though - very comfortable night's sleep. There is free wireless in the lobby, which also provides a very cool, loungey place to hang out for drinks. The Acura car service is convenient - just FYI you will listen to a short car pitch. The location is also tough for a pure leisure traveler - it is right in the middle of the Loop which is dead on the weekends, and a bit of a walk to the clubs and non-touristy restaurants. Decent place for seeing theater though. I would only stay here if the rate you find is competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek European feel with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: wikedloki
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked a room at the W via Hotwire. Due to previous Hotwire hotel experiences, we had pretty low expectations. However, from the moment we arrived, we were treated fantastic by the staff at the W. The lobby, beautifully decorated to feel like a relaxing lounge, set the feel for the stay. The front desk staff and concierge was enthusiastic and went out of their way to be accommodating. Our room was located on the 7th floor and had a very European feel to it (small). There was just enough room for the bed, an improvised "built into the wall" couch as well as a desk, and just enough room in the bathroom for one person at a time. Even though the room was small, it was comfortable and nicely decorated. The only noticeable distraction was the sound of the L trains at street level, which sounded more like heavy rain. My partner and I spent most of our first evening in Chicago exploring the city. We returned to the hotel at around midnight absolutely exhausted and ready for a good night sleep. When we first entered the hotel, we were taken aback by the nightlife. Apparently, the hotel was hosting some sort of party in the lobby complete with a DJ. We made our way up to our room and collapsed on the bed. As we rested, we could clearly hear the loud music from the party enen though we were 7 floors above it. Cups on the nightstand and a mirrored wall were vibrating to the beat of the obnoxiously loud music. I called the concierge to inquire as to when the party would end and she told me 2am- another two hours! She said other guest had complained and she would report our complaint to the manager. Another 15 minutes, the music was still quite audible and walls still vibrating. My partner headed down to speak to the front desk. He returned five minutes later to tell me we were being moved up to the 19th floor. 20 minutes later, we were resting comfortably and most importantly -quietly- in our upgraded room. Kudos to the W for great customer service and correcting what could have been a very unpleasant night. The upgraded room on the 19th floor was very spacious and the bathroom was quite sizable. We could still here the L down at street level, but it wasn't much of a concern. Overall, this is a great hotel, nice rooms, perfect location for exploring the city, excellent staff, and they seem to know how to take care of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing guest room”
Reviews.Author: PATraveller1
Reviews.Content: I like the brand. The front desk was great and the concierge very helpful. But the guest room is surprisingly spartan with no furniture but the bed and a tiny upholstered chair. The bathroom was basic with a standard bath and shower nozzle. Wireless was not free. Maybe I have been spoiled by other chains, but it seems that I was spending a lot for a very utilitarian environment upstairs. My impression was that the developers skimped on the remodeling of what looks on the outside to be a rather dated hotel. The location for Loop business, especially at the Federal Court, cannot be beat, however.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like a rock star!”
Reviews.Author: martinigirlvic
Reviews.Content: This was my first W experience and I knew from the moment I walked in that I was going to have a great stay. The staff -- every single one that I came into contact with -- welcomed me, was warm and genuine. I felt like they really cared about me and wanted to do anything possible to make my stay a good one. I walked into my room and just visually it jumped out at me. Extraordinarily clean, well equipped, very inviting. I took pictures of my room and sent them to my friends and family with the phrase -- "Most awesome hotel room EVER"! Being a single, female traveler, I never once felt unsafe and was extremely comfortable. Room service was tasty and timely. My every request was responded to positively and accomodatingly. I have told all of my friends and family about the W hotels. If at all possible, I will stay at a W whenever I travel. I really did feel like a rock star!

Reviews.Title: “A clean, standard W hotel”
Reviews.Author: USTraveler12345
Reviews.Content: We were attending a friend's wedding in this hotel, so we decided to stay there instead of the one on lake shore. When we got there, we waited for almost 20 mins before we were checked in as there was only one person working at the reception desk on a late friday afternoon. So we really didn't have a good first impression. However, the lobby/lounge area was pretty neat with couches and a bar, perfect for a drink before heading out. The room that we got was pretty standard although it was a bit on the small side. It had modern and chic furnishings, and we were provided with Bliss toiletries. Parking, however, was pretty expensive, about $50/night. So we self-parked in a garage close-by which was cheaper. The hotel is located in the business district, so the area was a little quiet in the weekend. However it's a walkable distance to many restaurants and the magnificent mile for shopping. I'd recommend this hotel for business travelers, but if I were to return for another leisure trip, I might give the W by the Lake Shore a try.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Incredible, Let's Go Back ASAP!”
Reviews.Author: mmeow5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just so cool. The decor is awesome, the service is awesome, even the bath products are incredible (loved the face wash). I cannot wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “HORRID service- treated like a criminal”
Reviews.Author: gnewey
Reviews.Content: They pride themselves with their "WISH" and "Whatever, Whenever service"... but only only based on the what they want to do. Apparently asking for someone to come to my room to help me delete spam messages (left by the hotel) on my phone was unreasonable. The Whatever, Whenever agent seem to not want to help me out, after losing my cool on the phone, she came. And reported the incident to security. The next time I had the same request, they sent security banging at my door asking me to do it myself. HE WAS BANGING on my door. What the hell. Room service was always leave something behind. Once the brownie that took an hour, came wthout the icecream, it was brought up half hour later. This time round, they fotgot the cream for my bfast. They brought it, no apology from the phone clerk to the waiter as if it was routine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service is the hallmark of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rosebudmi
Reviews.Content: While I usually stay at Hilton hotels while on business, I was looking for a hotel in the financial district that would be close to those I planned to visit on this trip. The W Chicago City Center fit the bill, although the cost was more than I usually spend, even in Chicago. I justified it as to the location and that I could walk to almost all my appointments. In addition, the W Chicago City Center provides Acura transportation within a 5-mile radius of the hotel. This is great when you don't want to bother with a cab or you're in a hurry. From the moment I arrived, the service was impeccable. From the valet, to the doorman, to the registration desk, everyone was great. The bellman offered to fetch me some ice when I arrived as well. My only true disappointment was that my room was incredibly small. I barely had enough room to walk around the bed and the distance from the desk to the bed was about 2 feet. The bathroom was not as small as some may have alluded to on this website, but I would have appreciated a bit more counter space. Love the Bliss toiletries! And the towels are nice and fluffy, and I really appreciated the nice comfy robe! While the large screen HDTV was great, watching it from the bed was difficult as it was located above the desk on the left side of the bed. Also, sitting at the desk, I got a neck ache from watching the tv. It would have been better to have it located on the wall across from the bed. I too had a window looking out into a courtyard area, so I kept my blinds closed at all times. The smallness of the room made me a bit claustrophobic as I also had work to complete while staying there. I do wish there had been a coffeemaker already in the room, but I'm not sure where it would have been placed. There was not a lot of room on the desk to place another item. The bed was extremely comfortable and the faux fur throw was a lovely touch. I did order room service the first evening as I was extremely tried from traveling, traffic, etc. The food was good, but I was surprised at the limited menu. Would have liked to have seen more options. Was just too tired to go downstairs to enjoy the dining room. I cannot tell you how many times staff acknowledged me during my visit. Even the maids were extremely friendly as was the maintenance staff. The ambiance of the entire hotel is very chic, and I just wish my husband could have enjoyed this stay with me. While some may complain about the cost of valet parking and parking in general, it's downtown Chicago. I've had to pay $28 for 1 hour at some locations around town, so the $51 charge per night was not out of line from what I've been charged elsewhere. I travel all over the country, and the parking charges are NOT uncommon. The one thing I would definitely recommend would be free Internet connection. As this is NOT a bargain hotel, I do believe that free Wi-Fi at least should be included. All in all, this was a lovely hotel, and I would certainly like to stay here again some time. However, at a cost of over $300/night with taxes, I cannot justify the cost regularly.

Reviews.Title: “They need to fix the basics”
Reviews.Author: skating016
Reviews.Content: We had a block of rooms reserved. Our phone, and at least one other room's phone, did not work for in-coming calls from outside the hotel. (Room-to-room did work.) When someone tried to call me, the hotel said they did not have a listing under my name. So my caller tried another last name that was being used for at least 3 other rooms, yet the hotel claimed they did not have any room booked under that name either. When I called room-to-room asking for the second name, they did finally find it -- they had misspelled it. I did report the non-working phone. Don't know if they fixed it (you can't track when you don't get calls). And the phones in the room are difficult to work. We ended up hitting speaker phone to make calls. The hotel is obviously "cool," but I'd rather be in dull surroundings yet have a working phone. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “There aren't enough stars for service--I...”
Reviews.Author: TheSiren
Reviews.Content: There aren't enough stars for service--I would easily give this place a 10. The hotel was gorgeous and trendy, atmosphere was fantastic, and the service was like nothing like I've ever experienced....and I've stayed in a lot of hotels, all over the place. My friend and I came up for the Norah Jones concert and the staff made us feel like royalty. I will most definitely make the W City Center my Chicago hotel of choice in the future. Thanks again for the wonderful trip, W!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but in the middle of the business district”
Reviews.Author: trevindublin
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and the room. Nice lobbly with free wifi to catch up on things but if you arrive in tired on a friday night to lots of music and people this may not be your thing. reminded me a bit of the Faena in Buenos Aires. http://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g312741-d306696-Reviews-Faena_Hotel_Universe-Buenos_Aires_Capital_Federal_District.html my biggest grip $4 water in the rooms. like wifi it should be free. PS parking costs a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother...”
Reviews.Author: maspike
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler and like to stay at W Hotels when I can. Well this was my first time at the W City Center and for surely will be my last. This so called newly renovated hotel is far from being up to the W standards that I'm used to seeing. My check in experience was the only good part of my stay sadly. I had a very nice Hispanic woman help me out and even got me an early check in and upgraded room. The so called upgraded room was a joke. The new design of the room looked cheap and apparently was as everything was falling apart or didnâ€™t work. No hot water, dirty sheets, and broken safe. Upon checking out I voiced my comments on my stay with a lady who claimed to be the manager yet she did absolutely nothing nor did she even seem phased when I said that I wouldnâ€™t be returning...hmmm do they hear this all the time that they just donâ€™t care?

Reviews.Title: “Personalized service makes stay special”
Reviews.Author: ksfrogman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the "W" in downtown for 3 nights, and appreciate the extra service here. The layout of this hotel is unique, trendy and fun, but even more conventional setups are fine with me. After all, I just need a nice place to stay and relax. As I was here on business, banquet services was always available to take care of my needs, which is always a big stress reducer. They went beyond what I expected in helping me pack up items I needed to send out via FedEx. The concierge services person helped me get to the hotel from the airport by recommending transportation options. She even had the hotel provide me with a complimentary heat pack for my lower back when it was sore. I always felt like I was given all the personal attention I could ask for. To the staff of the "W," thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! One of the best hotel stays we've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: nekromanxer
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely fantastic stay at the W Chicago City Center this past Valentine's Day weekend. Upon arrival, we were told we had a complimentary upgrade - the room had gorgeous decor, lots of space, and a heavenly bed! The Acura Experience was also a great add-on. What we think sets the hotel head and shoulders above all the rest is the Whatever, Whenever "wish granting" service. (A fancy complimentary concierge serivce) In particular, seek out the services of Eden Bartel, who really made our weekend so memorable - from finding us a last minute reservation at a chic Asian fusion restaurant on Valentine's Day, to perfectly executing the procurement of rose petals (and delivered within 30 minutes again, on V-day, which is probably no small feat.) She then arranged for them to be scattered about our room while we were out, with a heart shape on the bed, and with champagne and chocolate strawberries thrown in FOR FREE to top it all off. Highly, Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Sohuggeidy
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago for an Car club event and decided to stay at this hotel instead of the host hotel becasue of the great price I found on their website. Since the moment I was greeted at the door I experienced great service, all the staff was friendly, helpful and I have to say good looking ;) I was promptly checked in. The room was somewhat small and I felt almost claustrophobic in the bathroom, but it was clean and very nicely decorated, the Bliss products provided were also of good quality. They have iPod docks so I listened to my own music while getting ready to go out. The Acura experience is a great plus, they take you anywhere in the downtown area. Valet parking is 40.00 a day The bar area is very trendly and is really easy to charge drinks to your room!

Reviews.Title: “The W made the 50th Golden!”
Reviews.Author: Veg-in-Training
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the W City Center Chicago on December 18th. We were celebrating my friend's 50th birthday. The hotel is conveniently located in the theater district. We very much enjoyed our stay. The room was very comfortable and nicely appointed. The only thing I can suggest is changing out the clocks to one that is not so glaringly bright. We put a piece of clothing over it to darken the room. Other than that it was perfect. I loved the Acura experience. It was very nice to be worry free on the way to our show. The driver was very accommodating (even when we forgot our tickets and had to go back). The vehicle was very nice. The bartender in the Living Room bar was a bit aloof and not very friendly, but we had heard there was some personnel changes going on that may have been making a few employees unhappy. The lobby area was beautiful and had a lively crowd. The best part of our stay was our dinner at Restaurant We. The hostess and the manager were both very friendly and accommodating. Our server James made our night. He was so much fun. He really seems to enjoy his job and his guests. I am vegetarian and he helped guide me around the menu. I always like to see more vegetarian entree options and a vegan option would be outstanding. James had great suggestions about things to do in the city. We told him we were going to see the Jersey Boys. He gave us some great suggestions on where to go after the show. When we returned to our room, James had arranged a very thoughtful and wonderful surprise for us. We found some champagne, some unbelievably delicious chocolate truffles, and a hard cover Jersey Boys book. This was a special touch that both my friend and I will always remember. I worked in the hotel/restaurant industry for years. I'm not always one to give glowing reviews because my expectations are high. Please make sure you do all you can to keep James on board. He is an outstanding asset to your hotel. We enjoyed the hotel amenities, and I would return to the restaurant solely for the great service. The property is excellent. I plan to try other W hotels because of this wonderful experience. Thank you so much for making a special birthday even more exceptional than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience created by incredible service!”
Reviews.Author: Kingston360
Reviews.Content: While the hotel had a great style and feel, my memorable stay was created by the wonderful staff at the W Hotel. The positive experience started from the first moment at the front check-in desk, where Maria and Erica treated me like a special guest. First impressions are important, and they are excellent at what they do. Every snigle employee at the hotel seemed sincerely happy to provide nothing but the best service to their guests. Unlike many hotels, no one at the W was just going through the motions - their smiles were real. The only reason why I didn't give the "sleep quality" five stars, was because of the train that passes near the hotel. Thanks for a great stay! I give this hotel my highest rating this hotel and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Hotel Room Ever”
Reviews.Author: Connecticut_Couple
